programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from south Wales compete to host the best dinner party and win the £1,000 prize, beginning with beautician Rachael and her partner Nick, who prepare a selection of dishes they've never made before. Dionne and Ameel prepare an Indian-inspired meal on the second night of the competition, before Angela and Jeff hope their no-nonsense menu can secure them the money.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, London Road Pawnbrokers boss Dan hunts for a local artist regarding potentially valuable paintings, and an unusual silver sombrero could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Penzance, Larry Kohen and Neil McLaughlin at Cashbrokers pawnbrokers go out to sea to test-drive a jet ski. Meanwhile, Lee has Crufts memorabilia he wants to sell, Dan and his team consider a houseboat, and a Picasso is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples who are struggling to find suitable flats in Edinburgh because of the competitive market and their demanding search criteria. The first, Matt, a professional rugby player and his girlfriend Amy, have viewed more than 100 properties without success. The second pair, Sarah and Dom, are relocating from London with their one-year-old son and have a £600,000 budget, but too many special requirements for their dream home.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a couple searching for a house in East Sussex that is far away from neighbours without being remote, as well as a woman looking for a home in the Cotswolds.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in the Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by his friend, fellow B&B owner Jeronime Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charity manager Andrew Batsford hosts the first of a week of parties from Hastings, aiming to inspire his fellow contestants with a menu of dishes prepared using foraged ingredients, including sea broccoli and stinging nettles. However, if the food fails to win them over, he hopes a dynamic Wham!-themed evening of festivities will do the trick.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Hastings, East Sussex, and retired solicitor Adrian Carter is hoping to impress his guests with a Moroccan-themed evening. However, disaster strikes when he neglects his tagine, and his rendition of a Rod Stewart classic does not go down well either.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sally-Anne Keller hosts a German-themed dinner party on the third night in Hastings, East Sussex, and requires her guests to dress, sing and dance accordingly. Charity manager Andrew Batsford explains how the principles of anarchism and punk can be applied to football, while retired solicitor Adrian Carter dresses as the 19th-century statesman Otto von Bismarck and raises eyebrows with his jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Kate Eadon hosts the fourth dinner party in Hastings, East Sussex, with a menu styled on a gourmet pub meal. Adrian Carter gets himself in hot water, Sally-Anne Keller reveals a surprise celebrity crush, and the host recounts her own encounter with a famous funnyman.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The confident Stelios Michael hosts the final night in Hastings, East Sussex, hoping to impress his guests with a Greek-inspired evening. The diners get involved when they receive a masterclass in the country's traditional dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on The Crystal Maze Celebrity Special, The Great Pottery Throw Down and classic movie The Jungle Book.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides Joel Dommett, Jermaine Jenas, Adil Ray, Tamara Wall and team captain Rylan Clark-Neal on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team members must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Diners include Sherry, a 65-year-old dominatrix looking for romance. She hopes chartered surveyor and t'ai chi enthusiast John might be the man for her. Meanwhile, Hannah, 40, is looking for a man who shares her love of adventure. Could 42-year-old Christmas tree farmer Rob be her Mr Right?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan, and Bill Bailey in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Life Behind Bars: Visiting Hour
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the visiting room at HMP Low Moss, one of Scotland's largest maximum security prisons. It offers an insight into the people doing hard time as they meet loved ones. Featured contributors include Gary and Charley who plan their wedding, even though he doesn't have a release date. Meanwhile, fellow inmate Mike receives a visit from his ageing father.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet animal clips, with videos featuring extreme shepherding in Wales, the tale of a vengeful lion in Africa, and a New Zealand monster mystery.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Swansea and Bridgend compete to throw the best dinner party. Kathy and Justin kick off the competition with an Italian-inspired menu, which is overshadowed by Paul's poor table manners and tactless banter. Mark and Maria are the next to host and serve their leftovers-inspired starter, chicken lettuce boats. Finally, it's time for Kathy to wreak revenge during Paul and Sarah's evening. Chaos in the kitchen ensues, culminating in a showdown at the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan takes his sister to test drive a monster truck, Wendy comes across a handbag that could be very valuable, and Larry and Neil examine some works of art bought in a pub.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Windsor in Berkshire to guide Paul and Alissa, who hope to buy a mansion, but have a limited budget. They also advise Matt, who wants to settle down close to his family after a period of travelling and get on the property ladder.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Home Counties air stewardess Karon and Newcastle duo Anita and Andrew find the properties of their dreams.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson host at the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough, where Julie and James are not impressed by the dated bathrooms.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: NHS manager Helen Mather holds the first party in Leicester, hoping her plans for a simple menu will allow her more time to entertain her guests. However, the accident-prone host has a mishap involving raw pig's blood, and tries to turn the evening around with some `urban ballet' after one diner sours the mood with a display of less-than-polite table manners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Terry Robinson hosts the second dinner party in Leicester with a `Dress as Your Hero' theme, and the Elton John fan also decides to treat his guests to a song. He is confident his menu will score him top marks, but while Richard is blown away, Ryan remains unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty spa manager Porchia Lee hosts the third dinner party in Leicester, serving up a French-themed menu of chicken liver pate, pan-fried chicken with tarragon sauce and creme brulee. Unfortunately for her the pudding is so bad her guests are reduced to tears, and double glazing salesman Richard Deeping insults her appearance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT enthusiast Ryan Bruce hosts the fourth dinner party in Leicester, and tries to impress his guests with a Spanish-inspired menu cooked in front of them. Entertainment is provided by Ryan's sister, West End actress Charlie Bruce, who puts the contestants through their paces in a salsa lesson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Double-glazing salesman Richard Deeping hosts the final dinner party in Leicester, and hopes to make up for his boisterous behaviour by impressing the guests with his culinary prowess. In a bid to land higher scores, he puts on his own brand of entertainment, only to reveal a little too much of himself in the process, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help house-hunters in Oxfordshire, beginning with military couple Chris and Nikki, who have their hearts set on a rural home with plenty of potential to renovate. The property experts also come to the aid of Richard and Jane, who wish to move their large family into more suitable accommodation. Despite a budget of £500,000, the task seems impossible to achieve because of their extensive list of requirements.(n)

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.sub-title: Catching a Killer: The Wind in the Willows Murder.
programme.desc: In April last year, 42-year-old antiquarian book dealer Adrian Greenwood was found dead in his home, having been stabbed more than 30 times in a frenzied and brutal attack - with no suspects, no witnesses and no sign of forced entry. This documentary follows the work of the Thames Valley Police Major Crime Unit as Det Supt Kevin Brown and his team embark on their investigation into who killed Greenwood, as well as find out what happened to the victim's early edition of The Wind in the Willows, worth £50,000.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Christi learns her mother has been admitted to hospital, and must choose between being at her mother's side or attending her daughter's dance competition. Meanwhile, Cathy leads the other moms in a botox party in celebration of Kelly's 40th birthday.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Red's overbearing mother comes to stay, distracting Eric and making it difficult for him to finish an important assignment - so the rest of the gang rallies round to help him complete it. Guest starring Marion Ross (Happy Days).(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's rich new friend turns out to be gay, prompting him to ask searching questions about his own sexuality, and Red questions his potential as an appliance salesman. Guest starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt (500 Days of Summer).(n)

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: An architect has a fling with a kooky waitress, who takes it upon herself to move into his house and pass herself off as his wife. When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the sham marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In south London, Del and Dael Anglin receive a hostile reception from the brother of a debtor who has alreasy defaulted on a promise to pay £2,000 she owes to a storage company. In Worcestershire, Gareth and Craig try to recover £45,000 from a young online entrepreneur, who claims no responsibility for the debt he owes to his courier. Their target cooks up a flimsy lie in an effort to absolve himself, but dishonesty proves to be the least of the agents' worries when they discover a stash of guns at the back of the garage. In east London, an Indian restaurant owner begins to take his financial responsibilities seriously when Del and Dael start removing cookers and freezers from his premises, and a pair of pensioners in Oxfordshire hope the High Court will provide them a lifeline as they try to pay off a £4,000 bill to a solicitors' firm after a failed compensation claim.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Gareth and Craig investigate a possible case of mistaken identity in Shropshire, then in south Wales find themselves embroiled in a bitter dispute between two dog owners over a vet's bill. programme.desc: Timid, immature would-be author Owen still lives with his domineering mother, and fantasises about killing her. programme.desc: Max decides to leave the Wilsons', Carter deals with a betrayal by Bird, while Lori is back - and she has a plan. Drama, starring Kathryn Prescott.(n)

programme.title: And Proud
programme.desc: Documentary examining the lifestyles of some of those living on benefits who are not currently seeking employment, including a Gloucestershire mother-of-11 who receives benefits equivalent to three times the typical UK family income. Also featured are a Liverpool couple who have not worked for six years, and two single mums in Camden whose rents are more than £1,200 a month each and are paid by the state.(n)

programme.desc: Channing threatens to close down the garden project, Jake takes steps to stop Will from exposing him, and Bridget gets a reprimand for drunkenness.(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: Jim Sheridan ("My Left Foot") co-wrote and directed this heartwarming drama about a scrappy Irish clan adjusting to life in a New York City tenement in the 1980s while trying to put a family tragedy behind them. Samantha Morton, Paddy Considine, Djimon Hounsou, Sarah Bolger, Emma Bolger, Juan Hernandez, Jason Salkey, Rene Millan(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: In this millennial screwball comedy, Tracy (Lola Kirke), a mousy college freshman living on her own in New York City meets Brooke (Greta Gerwig), her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature. Written and Directed by Noah Baumbach(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin. This comedy features Martin Short, Kurt Russell, Mary Kay Place, with Benjamin Salisbury and Meadow Sisto as the two children(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Black comedy about an alcoholic con man who robs department stores every Christmas Eve by working as a resident Santa Claus. However, his latest plan is complicated by an unlikely romance, the unwanted suspicions of a store security chief and an improbable friendship with a lonely eight-year-old boy(n)

programme.title: Casanova
programme.desc: A retelling of the legend of the infamous 18th-century Venetian lover. Casanova is ordered to clean up his act and marry a virtuous virgin by the Doge, but opts to pursue her tempestuous sister instead(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: Romantic comedy written and directed by Woody Allen. Jerry is an aspiring comedy writer living in New York City with his neurotic girlfriend. He is having difficulty getting his career off the ground, not least because of his incompetent agent and increasingly paranoid mentor. His life becomes even more complicated when his girlfriend's mother - who harbours ambitions of becoming a cabaret singer - moves in(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comic jewels Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, who once shared the "Saturday Night Live" stage, reunite in this outrageous romp. Fey's a buttoned-down career woman who agrees to let loopy working-class girl Poehler become the surrogate mother of her child. Steve Martin costars as Fey's New Age health-food entrepreneur boss, and Sigourney Weaver is hilarious as a smug director of the surrogacy agency. Written and directed by Michael McCullers, former writer at "SNL."(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller directs and stars in this satire on the fashion industry as the eponymous Zoolander, an air-head male model who's eclipsed by the equally vacuous Hansel. To make matters worse, fashion designer Mugatu plans to turn Zoolander into an international assassin(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: The third entry into the "Die Hard" series, this action film finds maverick cop John McClane and Harlem shopkeeper Zeus on a mission to stop a subway terrorist. John and Zeus must follow increasingly challenging commands from the mysterious "Simon" in order to prevent him from detonating a series of bombs(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Director Marc Forster, winner of Best Feature at Slamdance for his debut film Loungers (1996) and the "Someone to Watch" Independent Spirit Award for his indie drama Everything Put Together (2000), follows up those acclaimed projects with this intense, racially charged romance. Billy Bob Thornton stars as Georgia prison guard Hank Grotowski, a hard-drinking racist ex-cop whose father, Buck (Peter Boyle), is dying of emphysema and whose son, Sonny (Heath Ledger), works the execution detail at the prison's death row. When Sonny commits suicide, Hank is devastated and quits his job, spiraling into a deep depression until, one night, he comes to the aid of Leticia (Halle Berry), a beautiful African-American woman whose son, Tyrell (Coronji Calhoun), has been hit by a car. When Tyrell dies, Leticia and Hank find themselves to be unexpected soul mates linked together by tragic grief. It's not long before Hank discovers that Leticia is the widow of Lawrence Musgrove (Sean Combs), the man whose execution by electric chair he and his late son helped to orchestrate. Monster's Ball (2001) is based on a screenplay by actors Milo Addica and Will Rokos, who spent five years developing their script into a feature. Their title refers to the name of an English tradition requiring jailers to throw a party for a condemned man on the night before his death(n)

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: In 1959, a black maid is hired by a grieving white widower to care for his withdrawn daughter; the woman has no experience but she makes an immediate connection with the girl(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: In this film, adventure writer Kathleen Turner learns that her sister is being held prisoner by evil art dealers in Colombia. It seems that sis has mailed Turner a map leading to a valuable treasure. In her search for the treasure, Turner teams up with soldier of fortune Michael Douglas(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind ex-army man, Lt. Colonel Frank Slade meets up with a young student and they both head off to New York for a weekend that will change their lives..(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: In this drama, a radiant 19-year-old American summers at an Italian villa to have her portrait done by a sculptor. During her stay, she looks for romance and also tries to learn the identity of her biological father. Gorgeous locations and lyrical cinematography add poetry to this sensual coming-of-age story(n)

After the death of his wife from typhoid, the young Earp descends into drinking and petty crime until his father sobers him up and sets him on the road to becoming a respected sheriff in Dodge City and Tombstone where he faces his greatest battle(n)

Julie Christie, Eric Bana, Peter O'Toole, Brendan Gleeson, Brian Cox, Sean Bean(n)

When Burmese soldiers attack the Karen village, Rambo is asked to transport a mercenary rescue team(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: An ex-Marine inhabits a cloned alien body to conduct research on a distant planet. But when his fellow humans cause devastation, he ends up fighting for the Na'vi race(n)

programme.desc: Tense American football drama about an ageing coach holding his team together through a losing streak. Ownership of the team is inherited by a determined young businesswoman who increases the pressure to come up with winning results. When the team's 39-year-old star player is injured and his capable young replacement is more interested in personal glory than team spirit, the coach must reevaluate his life and loyalties(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Atmospheric western about a lone, gun-toting preacher who defends a settlement from attack. In the late 1800s, a young girl witnesses a violent attack on a gold-mining settlement and prays for a miracle to save the camp and its people. Her prayers seem answered when a stranger arrives and helps the prospectors defend themselves. But his real motives are a mystery(n)

programme.title: The Arrival

An alienated teen is bitten by a mutated spider during a school outing and subsequently develops incredible powers. As he endeavours to come to terms with his new-found abilities, he's also forced to contend with a maniacal villain, the Green Goblin(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: Slapstick comedy about a pair of idiotic friends who set off on a madcap journey to return a briefcase to its owner. However, they are blissfully unaware that the case contains a large amount of ransom money for the owner's kidnapped husband. Their trip is soon fraught with disaster, especially when the kidnappers begin to pursue them across the country with the aim of grabbing the cash(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Sonny plans a bank robbery to pay for a sex-change operation for his gay lover. But when the heist goes wrong, he and silent Sal take the bank staff hostage. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory

programme.title: Spider-Man

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Two handymen from Perfection, get side-tracked from plans of escaping a dull life when corpses begin piling up and a road crew provides lunch for creepy creatures(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: It's not easy to win back a woman after leaving her at the altar, but when an out-of-shape man finally realises just what a mistake he's made, he vows to run a high-profile marathon in order to convince his ex-fiancée that the rich and handsome man she's about to marry isn't the guy for her(n)

programme.title: Snow White: A Tale of Terror
programme.desc: Emmy nominated for her role in this horror version of the classic fairy tale, Sigourney Weaver stars alongside Sam Neil, Gil Bellows and Brian Glover, as the evil stepmother. Seven years after the death of his beloved wife, Frederick Hoffman remarries the attention grabbing Lady Claudia. She moves into Hoffman's family home and plays stepmother to his precious daughter Lilli. But it isn't long before Claudia becomes endlessly jealous of her beautiful stepdaughter and orders her bother to kill her. Although Lilli escapes to a dark forest where she befriends a team of miners, she is not yet safe. Lady Claudia, adamant to have Frederick to herself, uses sorcery to try and kill off Lilli instead(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility(n)

programme.title: Alien 3

Writer-director Guillermo del Toro's sequel improves on his original, showcasing wickedly elegant monsters and spectacular action sequences(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: Set in the Aokigahara Forest, which is a place where people commit suicides, a young American woman, Sara, is in search of her twin sister, who has mysteriously disappeared in the forest. Despite the warnings from the villagers, Sara travels into the ghost-filled forest to save her sister to discover the truth while being confronted by angry and tormented souls of the dead that prey on anyone who crosses their paths(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

The creatures' fear of light seems to guarantee the survivors' safety - but when an eclipse takes place, they face a desperate struggle to survive. Their only hope lies with a convicted murderer, who is equally at home in the darkness - but is far from trustworthy(n)

programme.title: MI-5

programme.desc: Agent 47 (Rupert Friend), known only by the barcode tattoo on his neck, is an elite international assassin. Engineered to be an unstoppable killing machine, 47 is contracted by a covert organization to assassinate high-profile targets on a global scale. He's given the assignment to kill the leader of a crime syndicate who wishes to unlock the secrets behind 47's powers and harness that information into an army of highly skilled hit men. As 47 races to complete his mission, new information emerges about his origins and sparks a race against time as the agent is hunted for the secrets behind his skills. programme.desc: Devil's Island. The Devil's Island prison in tropical French Guiana is visited regarding tales of escapees(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Distant War (September 1939 - May 1940). This video is part two in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. Hosted by Laurence Olivier, the programs were originally televised on Sunday evenings in 1974. This episode focuses on the German advance on Poland and Norway from September, 1939, through May, 1940. The English and French, still untouched by war in their own lands, gather their forces(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: France Falls (May - June 1940). This video is part three in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. These historic television broadcasts originally appeared on Sunday evenings in 1974. This episode follows the advance of Hitler's army into France in May and June of 1940, and its frightening march into Paris. England stood alone in Europe against the German army. Meanwhile, Russian troops were occupying Poland and the Balkan states(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Bomb (February - September 1945). Defeat looms for the aggressors on the Western and Pacific fronts in a chronicle of the concluding action in the war, January-August 1945. Included: film footage of the Russian offensive through Poland and the encirclement of Berlin by the armies of Zhukov and Koniev; and the atomic destruction of the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Laurence Olivier is the narrator(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Reckoning (April 1945). This video is episode 25 in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. Narrated by Laurence Olivier, the highly acclaimed series first aired on television in 1974. This program considers the aftermath of the war. The political considerations and decisions had far reaching effects. There were war reparations to be made to punish the aggressors, the stabilization and rebuilding of Europe got underway, and the Japanese sociopolitical infrastructure was revolutionized. War criminals were brought to justice at the Nuremberg Trials, and the Soviets gained control of Eastern Europe and dropped the Iron Curtain(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit cottages in Cumbria and Cornwall, and a retail building in Wimbledon, south-west London, that are about to be sold at auction. After the sales they meet their new owners, then later find out how their plans for development have gone.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Cameras follow neighbourhood police in Weston-super-Mare as they crack down on crime with a series of raids.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report from Barcelona, where they find out how police are tackling the city's reputation as the pickpocket capital of Europe.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help two teams of couples find bargains at an antiques fair in the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, with Anita Manning overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, where the last-16 singles matches are scheduled to be the main attraction. Andy Murray recorded a 7-5, 6-1, 6-4 victory over the mercurial Nick Kyrgios at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament, in what was expected to be a much tougher encounter for the British number one. Meanwhile, Roger Federer faced little trouble as he defeated Steve Johnson in straight sets to also secure his passage to the next round, where he would go on to face Marin Cilic.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Mini Monet Millionaire
programme.desc: Martin Shaw narrates a profile of 14-year-old painter Kieron Williamson, who held his first show at the age of six and is already worth £2,000,000. With access to the Williamson household, this film follows Kieron's preparations for a major exhibition, revealing how his career is managed by his parents. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A concerned Karen pushes Bernadette to reveal the father's name, while Abi is put out when Steven rejects her and goes on to reveal what he heard Lauren saying about their relationship. The market traders are in uproar when Robbie evicts Donna from her pitch, and Denise quits her job as Pearl's nanny to take on her new job at the council - upsetting Kim in the process.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Britain's Food & Farming: The Brexit Effect - Panorama.
programme.desc: The EU dictates what farmers are allowed to grow, sets animal welfare standards and offers a large supply of cheap labour to work in the fields and processing plants. In this programme, Tom Heap talks to insiders who claim Brexit will mean higher prices, lower quality and less choice on the supermarket shelves, as well as others who believe it's a fantastic opportunity to address inefficiency and design a new mode of food production for the next generation. Will UK consumers back British farmers, or switch to potentially cheaper imports of hormone-filled meat from abroad?.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the retailers' attempts to outdo one another in terms of convenience - one of the fastest-growing battlegrounds. Gregg Wallace discovers how supermarkets decide where to open small stores, while Babita Sharma travels to Spain on the trail of easy peel fruit. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director recalls an ambitious nationwide challenge for Comic Relief and discusses his involvement in an armed raid with chat show supremo Michael Parkinson. Featuring appearances by This Morning hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedians Kevin Bridges and Roisin Conaty joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's major issues.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: New series. The genealogy documentary follows 10 more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is actor Charles Dance, who has made his name playing aristocrats - a far cry from his own background, having been born to a parlour maid. He wants to know if he comes from a long line of servants or if he can uncover some grander origins. The actor is also determined to find out about his father, who died when he was four and about whom he knows hardly anything - a search that takes him to the other side of the world.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help a family desperate to save enough cash to adapt their home for a wheelchair, with experts looking to curb their impulsive spending habits.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martel Maxwell and Dion Dublin visit properties in Bilston, Wolverhampton, Nettlestead Green in Kent and Etruria in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Police race to find two suspects when a young man is stabbed in Weston-super-Mare, while a brutal assault on a woman pushing a pram is caught on a bystander's phone in Bath.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate how a company sent one family to a succession of villas they had no right to stay in.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, where the last-eight of the ladies' singles draw is the main attraction of the day. Two of last year's matches featured seeded players going up against one another on Centre Court for a place in the last-four, and the opening encounter saw Germany's Angelique Kerber record a 7-5, 7-6 victory over Romania's Simona Halep. Following that contest, top seed Serena Williams faced Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova, who was appearing in just her third Grand Slam quarter-final, and her first at Wimbledon, but the Russian would sadly see her run come to an end as Williams triumphed 6-4, 6-4. Other matches due to take place today include the quarter-finals in both the men's and ladies doubles competitions.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren struggles to tell Steven it is over between them, so she confides in Max, while Abi sees an opportunity to push the pair apart so she can finally get her claws into her sister's boyfriend. Denise tries - and fails - to tell Carmel she is not invited on the group holiday, and Patrick and Ted compete for the job of pot-washer at the Vic.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac and Fran get the shock of their lives when someone from their past turns up at the hospital, while Raf is ribbed by Fletch, spotting that he likes Essie a bit more than he's letting on, and encourages him to give things another go. When Donna's old schoolmate is admitted, she soon realises how her life has been completely turned upside down, and she has to face her fears.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: New series. As DI Helen Weeks grapples apprehensively with pregnancy, she is compelled to return to her loathed rural home town of Polesford, Derbyshire, with her partner and fellow detective Paul Hopkins. Two girls have been abducted and the man arrested is the husband of Helen's childhood best friend Linda Bates, who has been drawn into the centre of a media storm, while the local police force is under enormous pressure to get their man. But is he guilty? Crime drama adapted by Danny Brocklehurst from Mark Billingham's books, starring MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Grandad, Dementia & Me
programme.desc: Moving and intimate documentary following Tom Sivyer and his family after he is diagnosed with vascular dementia in 2014, filmed by his grandson Dominic. Shot over two years, the film captures Tom's rapid mental decline, and the attempts of his family to care for a once fiercely independent and proud man.(n)

programme.title: Mini Monet Millionaire
programme.desc: Martin Shaw narrates a profile of 14-year-old painter Kieron Williamson, who held his first show at the age of six and is already worth £2,000,000. With access to the Williamson household, this film follows Kieron's preparations for a major exhibition, revealing how his career is managed by his parents. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Former politician and Strictly star Ann Widdecombe tells Brian Conley about significant TV shows and characters from her past, including sailing soap Howards' Way, music and entertainment show Six-Five Special, Richard Chamberlain as Dr Kildare and 1960 biblical drama Paul of Tarsus.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team share some secrets on when damage definitely does not have to mean disaster. Plus, Adam Partridge reveals a hidden talent.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined in York by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. The reds and blue teams have the choice of two antique centres to buy three items to take to auction in Darlington. Eric also finds out about the city's long association with confectionery at its Castle Museum.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a woman's ashes.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day seven at the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' fourth-round singles matches are due to get under way, while there is also a look back at some of the greatest moments at SW19, on what is the 90th anniversary of the BBC's first radio coverage of the Grand Slam. Agnieszka Radwanska was the highest-seeded casualty in the ladies draw on this day last year, as she fell to a 6-3, 5-7, 9-7 defeat to the number 19 seed, Dominika Cibulkova. That match was not the only epic encounter to take place on court number three, as Russia's Elena Vesnina battled to a 5-7, 6-1, 9-7 triumph over her compatriot Ekaterina Makarova, to set up a quarter-final against Dominika Cibulkova. Over on centre court, eventual champion Serena Williams recorded a fairly one-sided 7-5, 6-0 win over Svetlana Kuznetsova, while perhaps the standout contest of the day saw Simona Halep face Madison Keys on Number One court, with the former eventually coming out on top by a score of 6-7, 6-4, 6-3.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the seventh day's play, where the line-up for the quarter-finals in the singles draws was set to be decided. While the men to emerge victorious know that they are in line for a rest day ahead of their last-eight encounters, the ladies will have a quick turnaround and be back in action tomorrow, so Clare and her guests will also preview those matches.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Thatcher finds Robin and puts the boy into the care of Reid, Jackson and Long Susan, who manage to uncover information that they hope may lead them to Nathaniel. They arrive at the Sumner house only to discover it has been cleaned and the two bodies disposed of. Shine turns up and is surprised to learn of the true identity of the killer and heads of to confront Augustus Dove about his brother, but the assistant commissioner manages to persuade Shine that Reid is the bigger threat. Matthew Macfadyen stars.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Theresa v Boris: How May Became PM
programme.desc: Docu-drama telling the story of the Conservative Party's 2016 leadership campaign, from the day David Cameron resigned to the day Theresa May became Prime Minister. Based on exhaustive research and first-person testimonies, this dramatised narrative goes beyond the headlines to lay bare the politicking and positioning, betrayals and blunders of this extraordinary political time. The programme also features key interviews with people who were intimately involved in the campaigns of the main contenders.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison meets a family making natural cordials and presses using their own elderflowers, before visiting Worcester Cathedral to catch a glimpse of its lesser horseshoe bats, thought to be the only urban population in the country. Adam Henson heads to the Peak District and explains why he has decided to send his beef cattle to an animal sanctuary in Norfolk rather than the slaughterhouse.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace returns with the programme that goes behind the scenes with Britain's biggest food retailers, finding out how they are using the latest science and technology to stay ahead of the competition. Gregg discovers the hi-tech acoustic testing Asda are using to get an edge in the battle to bring customers the perfect avocado, while Babita Sharma learns about the intelligence gatherers who know more about what shoppers buy and why than they do.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts talks to Brian Conley about his favourite TV shows from his childhood, including The Goodies, Trumpton and Call My Bluff.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: New series. Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis return to reveal more ways in which consumers can save money and manage their spending better, beginning by helping a widow.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: George Riley presents action from the latest fixtures, including Wakefield Trinity v Castleford Tigers, St Helens v Hull FC and Salford Red Devils v Leeds Rhinos.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Telford.
programme.desc: The building crusaders come to the aid of 12-year-old Matthew from Telford, who has been stuck in hospital for three years after suffering cancer and a stroke. The youngster's head teacher and school friends have been fundraising to get him home, so now, Nick Knowles and the team - with the help of hundreds of volunteers - set out to make Matthew's home suitable for his complex medical needs.(n)

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day eight at the All England Club, where the ladies' quarter-final singles matches are due to take place. Two of the last-eight matches at last year's tournament involved unseeded players, and it was Elena Vesnina of Russia who made headlines on the day by recording a 6-2, 6-2 victory over 19th seed Dominika Cibulkova, in what was her first quarter-final at a Grand Slam. Meanwhile, Yaroslava Shvedova saw her run come to an end as she fell to a 7-6, 6-2 defeat against five-time champion Venus Williams, but the Kazakh could still be proud of her performance at the tournament having progressed farther than she ever had before. Fans on Centre Court were also treated to an epic encounter in the third round of the gentlemen's doubles on the corresponding day last year, as Americans Bob and Mike Bryan were pushed all the way by the pairing of Radek Stepanek and Nenad Zimonjic, eventually prevailing 7-5, 6-7, 6-4, 3-6, 6-3.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the eighth day's play, where the line-up for the ladies' singles semi-finals was due to be decided, as the battle to succeed Serena Williams as champion continued. Plus, there's a round-up of the day's headlines, as well as a look ahead to the men's singles quarter-finals, which are scheduled to enthrall the crowds at SW19 tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: How Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust is pushing the boundaries of what is possible technologically, at a time when the Trust has a planned annual deficit of £41 million and savings need to be made across the board. Meanwhile, at Charing Cross Hospital, site of the Trust's specialist neurosurgery department, 28-year-old former dancer Ben needs an operation to remove a recurrent brain tumour, and at Hammersmith, 23-year-old primary school teacher Rosa has an infection on her mitral valve called endocarditis.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Sophie seems to be making progress with her new friend at the library, while the club is visited by the mayor on a matter of some delicacy. Peter's quest to find his grandmother has attracted the attention of some old enemies and Andy spots something suspicious. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Daniel Donskov.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Mark Urban.(n)

programme.title: Brexit Means Brexit: The Unofficial Version
programme.desc: Award-winning director Patrick Forbes goes beyond the headlines to film the battle to govern Britain, after last year's Referendum vote on 23rd June 2016. Filmed over one extraordinary year since the public voted to leave the European Union, it is a story of low politics, high ambition and bitter personal animosities, with the biggest decision the country has faced in decades at stake. Can the Prime Minister tame the judges, the opposition, and finally the public to deliver Brexit?.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Oakham in Rutland, where he learns about a noble tradition dating back to the Middle Ages and decides to take part. Heading east to Stamford, Lincolnshire, he discovers why the town is such an attractive location for period dramas, while a ghoulish scene awaits in Peterborough when he visits a Victorian operating theatre where railwaymen were treated. Michael's last stop on his journey is Christ's College at Cambridge University, where he finds out about the student days of Charles Darwin. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili continues his investigation into scientific methods originating from the Islamic world with a trip to Northern Syria, where he learns about Al-Biruni, the astronomer and mathematician who, 1,000 years ago, estimated the size of Earth to within a few hundred miles of the correct figure. He also visits Cairo to explore physicist Ibn al-Haytham's contribution to the modern science of optics.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: This Was My Dad: The Rise and Fall of Geoffrey Matthews - Storyville.
programme.desc: Film-maker Morgan Matthews' documentary charts 10 years in the life of his father Geoff, following him through a financial crisis and the onset of emphysema and cancer.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates another documentary revealing the survival techniques of the animal kingdom's smallest creatures. This film follows a young tree shrew as it darts through the rainforest of Borneo on the lookout for food. The creature's super-fast metabolism means it is always hungry, but as it searches for fruit, it must avoid fire ants, giant snakes and even a carnivorous plant. Cameras also follow a male chipmunk collecting acorns in preparation for winter - but while he's out, a bigger, more aggressive neighbour ransacks his store. Can he get the nuts back?.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili continues his investigation into scientific methods originating from the Islamic world with a trip to Northern Syria, where he learns about Al-Biruni, the astronomer and mathematician who, 1,000 years ago, estimated the size of Earth to within a few hundred miles of the correct figure. He also visits Cairo to explore physicist Ibn al-Haytham's contribution to the modern science of optics.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating handcrafted objects made under the royal warrant, beginning by following the creation of a Wedgwood panther vase by artisan potters. The programme also takes a look at how this quintessentially British company is reinventing itself for the 21st century under new, foreign ownership.(n)

programme.title: Britain Beneath Your Feet
programme.desc: In the second of a two-part documentary about the fascinating world down below, Dallas Campbell reveals what goes on underground to keep the country on the move. He meets the hidden army of workers who keep Britain running, from the drivers of the largest tunnelling machines in the world to the engineers running a vast power station beneath a mountain in Wales. He also discovers how a secret wartime pipeline is now delivering fuel to Heathrow Airport, and helps to relocate a group of badgers who are threatening the foundations of a primary school.(n)

programme.title: The British Garden: Life and Death on Your Lawn
programme.desc: Chris Packham and a group of experts spend 12 months scrutinising the wildlife in eight gardens on a suburban street in Welwyn Garden City. Throughout the seasons they find male crickets that bribe females with food during sex, spiders that change colour to help catch prey, and ferocious life-and-death battles in the compost heap. They also shows a different side to familiar garden residents, revealing how a robin's red breast is actually war paint, and a single litter of foxes can have up to five different fathers.(n)

programme.title: Deep, Down and Dirty - The Science of Soil
programme.desc: Gardening expert Chris Beardshaw explores where soil comes from, and what it is made of. It is an often misunderstood substance, with people sometimes dismissing it as dirt, so he reveals it as it has never been seen before using specialist microphotography, and highlights what makes it so essential to life. Research shows that humans are pushing this precious resource to its limit, and scientists are battling to find ways of preserving it for the future.(n)

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: A look at the 1980s when contemporary architecture was unpopular and under attack from the Prince of Wales. British architects discuss the stories behind their most famous creations including Richard Rogers' Lloyd's of London building and Norman Foster's Stansted Airport. Terry Farrell reveals how he was kept in the dark while working on the MI6 Headquarters, and Michael Hopkins recalls the challenges of bringing modern design into the traditional world of Lord's Cricket Ground.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen is shocked to discover that Will is Stan's lawyer when her divorce proceedings get under way, while Grace's most important client has a fling with Jack. Guest starring Macaulay Culkin.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy's brother Peter turns to Ray for advice on talking to women, while Debra decides to help out by throwing a party and inviting all her single friends.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra nags Raymond to tidy up after himself, but he is more concerned with a letter he has received from his sporting hero - which accidentally ends up in the bin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin is given the night shift as punishment for refusing to take his boss's sister out on a date, and Frasier becomes jealous of his former agent Bebe's close relationship with a celebrity lifestyle guru. Guest starring Dr Phil McGraw.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin worries he may not be Niles and Frasier's father after noticing their similarities to his wife's former research partner. Meanwhile, Daphne enrols her yet-to-be-conceived child at an exclusive school. Comedy, guest starring David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz goes for a job interview at a rival station, and Frasier shares an impromptu kiss with Julia while trying to steal files from her ex's office. Niles visits a shooting range and ends up enjoying the experience far more than anticipated. American comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.sub-title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun: Davenport, Florida.
programme.desc: Angela and Michael Sidebotham from Lincolnshire are ready to fulfil their life-long dreams of buying a home in Davenport, Florida, where they plan to spend half of each year. With a budget of £160,000, Sara Damergi shows the couple five properties that meet their requirements.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria is the location for three more couples to demonstrate their cooking and hosting skills, kicking off with teachers Rory and Sam, who serve up dishes inspired by Europe. Day two sees Sarka and Paul lay on a Czech menu, but the massive portions defeat everyone - except the ever-hungry Rory. Finally, it's the turn of John and Sally with their retro 1980s evening. Which couple will win the cash prize of £1,000?.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan takes his sister to test drive a monster truck, Wendy comes across a handbag that could be very valuable, and Larry and Neil examine some works of art bought in a pub.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with historian and broadcaster Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps a couple with a £250,000 budget who have decided to move full time to northern Costa Blanca, but first they must choose from five possible homes.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a retired couple searching for a house in south Wales, as well as two keen sailors who want a property in Hampshire with easy access to the sea and London.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Five Bells near Dover, where manager Shelley Parnell and her competitive mum Linda Yates hope their bargain-priced B&B will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first of a week of dinner parties in Belfast is hosted by 30-year-old mobile phone sales manager Steve, who hopes to impress guests Justin, Julie, Cushla and Marty.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer accidentally declares himself bankrupt, while Bart and Lisa con a delivery man into giving them a large amount of cardboard boxes. Grampa leaves the Springfield Retirement Castle and ends up falling in love with Selma.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Granny Campbell wants Courtney to come back to Scotland and Grace freaks Warren out, while Darren plans a special foreign film night for Nancy, but when Kyle calls asking for them to visit, he begins to panic.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Britain's New Homes: Channel 4 Dispatches.
programme.desc: As the national spotlight falls on the need for Britain to build more high-quality affordable homes, this investigation asks why so few affordable properties are being constructed at a time when housebuilders have been making record profits. Reporter Antony Barnett travels across the country revealing how companies have failed to deliver affordable new homes and asks questions about the links between the Government and the property industry.(n)

programme.title: How to Retire at 40
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets people who have found ingenious or unusual ways to retire early, including friends who discovered how to buy property for less, a man who has made his fortune sending potatoes through the post; and a family who insist on only spending money two days a week. Journalist Sophie Morgan talks to trendspotters who are trailblazing new methods of saving money including how to get restaurant quality meals for a fraction of the price. Plus, consumer journalist Rhik Samadder meets some more of Britain's leading supersavers.(n)

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.sub-title: Catching a Killer: The Wind in the Willows Murder.
programme.desc: In April last year, 42-year-old antiquarian book dealer Adrian Greenwood was found dead in his home, having been stabbed more than 30 times in a frenzied and brutal attack - with no suspects, no witnesses and no sign of forced entry. This documentary follows the work of the Thames Valley Police Major Crime Unit as Det Supt Kevin Brown and his team embark on their investigation into who killed Greenwood, as well as find out what happened to the victim's early edition of The Wind in the Willows, worth £50,000.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: New series. The return of the programme in which Sheriff Jamey Noel tries to root out crime and corruption in an Indiana prison, sending eight more volunteers into Clark County Jail as undercover inmates to help him understand more about how drugs and contraband are getting into the facility. The first edition follows former corrections officer Sheri, ex-army reserve medic Ryan, retired police officer Quintin. and Monalisa, whose own daughter is incarcerated.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets people who love their body work and those who loathe it, including Jill, who painted the town red then rounded off the night with a DIY inking. Emily regrets a piercing that has left her with a lumpy earlobe, Kelly wishes she had never had her boob job and Mercedes cannot wait to get a mouth full of filler.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick pushes the boundaries of veterinary medicine, and treats a German shepherd puppy that needs surgery on his hips and front leg using groundbreaking cell treatment. The vet must also perform delicate surgery on a Chihuahua suffering from a neck deformity compressing its spinal cord - however, one false move could be fatal. Plus, a rescue dog with deformed front legs is brought into the surgery.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rothschild giraffe Orla is about to give birth to her second calf but is three weeks overdue. This episode captures the arrival of the giraffe family's youngest member and its introduction to the rest of the herd. Cameras also follow the Chester team as they attempt to save mountain chicken frogs from extinction, and there's a look at the secret world of three disruptive aardvarks.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho reveal how switching supermarket aisles can save customers money on their shopping. Plus, reports on whether vitamin drinks are worth the extra cash, kids' toothpastes that don't meet national guidelines, and controversial over-50s insurance policies.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr, Fred Sirieix, Jay Rayner, Stacie Stewart and Lucy Alexander taste-test four brands of Cheddar; chocolate sponge pudding and a ready meal chicken tikka masala. Plus, the public blind tasting session features four popular brands of cider.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits a house in Somerset with a recyled cinema, and heads to Cheltenham, where she goes to see a country cottage.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three rival sellers in Berkshire give their homes a ready-to-market makeover to impress buyer Ellie, including Joey and Lisa, who hope to banish beige from their lounge. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirsty Allsopp help a family with a budget of £400,000 search for a dream property in Derbyshire. Londoners Bryone and Daniel Burton hope to run a holiday-letting business from their home, but their extensive list of requirements presents a challenge for the hosts. Meanwhile, fashion designer Wendy Lee and photographer Simon Mackney look for a studio.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with historian and broadcaster Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen's husband Stan dies in the middle of their divorce proceedings, leaving her to contend with the problem of his will, which is complicated by the appearance of his mistress Lorraine. Guest starring Minnie Driver and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: The foursome goes on a yachting trip to the Caribbean to scatter Stan's ashes, while Leo flies to Guatemala with an attractive female colleague. Guest starring Minnie Driver, Harry Connick Jr, Deborah Harry and Nicollette Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: An offhand comment to the twins' new friend has dire consequences for Ray, who cannot understand why everyone is so upset - but he compounds his error by accidentally repeating the remark to the boy's father. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank puts salt on Marie's home-made lasagne, causing her to think she is turning into a terrible cook, but Ray and Robert discover their father has lost his sense of taste - apparently because of a potency medication he is taking. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle, Doris Roberts, Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz prepares to leave the radio station - but not before airing her views about Frasier's relationship with Julia. Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne take the plunge and decide to start a family.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Despite having quit her job twice, Roz returns to work at KACL as if nothing has happened, while Niles and Daphne invest in a variety of scientific gadgets to find the best time to conceive. Starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: A Man, a Plan and a Gal - Julia.
programme.desc: Julia attends a party with Frasier, where she manages to offend the entire Crane family by blurting out the news that Daphne is pregnant. Comedy, guest starring Felicity Hunter, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Kerry Herbert from Brighton has dreamed of buying a property on Grenada since she visited the Caribbean island as a child. With her teenage son about to fly the nest and after dealing with the loss of her father, she has decided to take the plunge and buy somewhere that she, her son and her partner can enjoy. Jonnie Irwin helps shows her five properties - but it remains to be seen whether any of them will tempt Kerry to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Paul and Glenda kick off the competition in their static caravan, but eyebrows are raised at his unromantic approach to his relationship. On day two self-confessed gadget geek David and his partner Jane show their competitive side with a confidently presented, well-received meal. Finally outdoorsy twentysomethings Matt and Polly show off their `good life' approach to cooking with a home-grown feast.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry from Cashbrokers in Penzance goes to look at some antique petrol pumps, while in south-east London childhood sweethearts want to pawn their jewellery to fund a family reunion.(n)

programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, featuring historian Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Chef Michel Roux Jr and a panel of food experts blind taste-test some of the nation's favourite food and drink. Joining the host is restaurant manager and First Dates' Fred Sirieix, journalist, broadcaster and critic Jay Rayner, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart, and TV presenter and foodie mum Lucy Alexander. The panel this week choose between four different brands of steak and ale pie, houmous and sauvignon blanc - the UK's most popular wine. Plus, the quick-fire public test is for cola drinks.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: The team investigates big-brand baby foods and finds some unexpected ingredients, while Fairy Original's longer-lasting claim is put to the test. Anna Richardson and Andi Osho check out if readers' offers are really as good as they sound and look into the high street in-store experiences that tempt us to spend again.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Find Me a Home
programme.desc: Phil tries to help two families who have been made homeless, but is shocked by the terrible housing conditions so many people are forced to endure. Corvel and Meyrem are a hard-working couple from Southwark in London, who are being evicted from their one-bedroom cockroach and rat-infested flat, while Bibi and her 15-year-old son Oscar were evicted from the home they'd lived in for 15 years and have hit a brick wall when it comes to finding a new place.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

The Queen's former butler instructs them in the subtle art of etiquette, while Her Majesty's official sculptor immortalises Eamonn's head in a traditional clay bust, before the couple find themselves partying with the daughters of high society at the elegant and exclusive Debutante's Ball.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary using dramatic reconstructions to examine some of Britain's most notorious murders, charting the last few days leading up to the killings from the perspectives of both the perpetrators and the victims. The first edition focuses on Jane Andrews, a former dresser to the Duchess of York, who bludgeoned and stabbed to death her millionaire boyfriend Thomas Cressman in an act of revenge after he told her that he would never propose.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the life and legacy of German painter Albrecht Durer, who set a new benchmark in self-portraiture and raised the artistic reputation of northern Europe to a level rivaling that of Renaissance Italy. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Abducting Zoe
programme.desc: A detective tries to help a sixteen-year-old in the search for her kidnapped baby. Crime drama, starring Sammi Hanratty, Alexandra Holden and Andrea Bowen.(n)
