programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A top secret device goes missing, and the bungling spy is teamed up with a brash American agent to recover it.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community. The first episode of the sitcom, starring Richard Briers as an obsessive middle-aged man who yearns to be at the centre of his local suburban neighbourhood. With Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast in 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: A new manager arrives at the recently built Whitbury leisure centre - but things get off to a shaky start when he selects a poolside attendant who cannot swim. First episode of the comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: A new manager arrives at the recently built Whitbury leisure centre - but things get off to a shaky start when he selects a poolside attendant who cannot swim. First episode of the comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels, and the only way to discover their contents is to open them. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: The Songs of Praise crew visits Dibley to record a programme in the village church. However, when Geraldine develops a crush on the producer her wayward emotions threaten to plunge the proceedings into disaster. Comedy, guest starring Peter Capaldi (The Thick of It).(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith suddenly becomes impressed by Lionel, while Alistair tries to woo Jean with a band and a gorillagram. Comedy, starring Judi Dench.(n)

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: The first episode of the award-winning comedy, starring Ricky Gervais. Admin manager David Brent is ordered to raise staff morale, just as head office starts dropping ominous hints about upcoming redundancies. With Martin Freeman. Lucy Davis and Mackenzie Crook.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. Gavin and Stacey have flirted for months on the phone at work but have never met up - until she travels from Wales to London to see him. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star alongside Rob Brydon, Alison Steadman, Ruth Jones and James Corden.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Hal Cruttenden hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before comedy circuit regulars Justin Moorhouse and Tom Stade take the mic.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Sophie tells Mark she and Jeff are moving in together, and the blow is compounded when she reveals she has been asked her to spend less time with him. Meanwhile, Jeremy becomes concerned about how his glum friend is coping with depression. Starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The squalid students get their hands on an atom bomb. Mike decides to try flogging it to Libya, while Rick intends to blackmail the government. Unfortunately, Vyvyan has bigger ideas - like blowing up the world. Guest starring Dexys Midnight Runners.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Hal Cruttenden hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before comedy circuit regulars Justin Moorhouse and Tom Stade take the mic.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.sub-title: The Black Adder: The Black Seal.
programme.desc: Edmund recruits a band consisting of the seven most evil men in the land in a dastardly plan to steal the throne - but whether he can trust his new-found friends is another matter. Guest starring Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Miss Postern foolishly signs up for a triathlon without knowing what it involves, so Mr Gunn offers to help with her training - and sure enough, jealous Mr Church develops a sudden interest in exercise so he can keep an eye on the pair. Meanwhile, drama teacher Mrs Klebb sets up a new action group to stop violence at school - although it remains to be seen whether her colleagues will take any notice.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches from comedy duo Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders, including a parody of Bjork and their version of Braveheart. Guest starring Patsy Kensit and Mel and Sue.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dafydd discovers Myfanwy's secret, while Vicky Pollard gives a speech to her former classmates. Liz and Clive are surprised when Mollie Sugden drops in on their local Chinese restaurant, and Michael meets the Italian prime minister. Starring Matt Lucas and David Walliams.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A couple's ordinary life is transformed by the intervention of MI5.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Fed up with doing everything himself, Martin hands in his resignation as chairman of the Residents' Association - and to his surprise, it is accepted. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Brittas takes charge of preparations for the official opening of Whitbury Leisure Center, with a royal visitor due to attend. Sadly, the builders dislike him so much they don't bother to tell him that the brand new pool is leaking. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager.
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: A violent storm destroys St Barnabas's stained glass window, and Geraldine is put in charge of raising funds to replace it - but the others are unsure whether any of her outlandish ideas will actually work. programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four chefs who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to make creme patissiere and use it as a base for a souffle. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's dish of lamb kidneys in a three-mustard sauce with a Savoyard potato cake, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining amateur bakers face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by preparing two varieties of flatbread for judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. The hopefuls then tackle a demanding technical challenge as they try to replicate Paul's recipe for an eight-strand plaited loaf, before receiving the dubious honour of becoming the first contestants in the show's history to make bagels. At the end of the day, Paul and Mary must decide who is this round's Star Baker - and who will be going home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The final heat sees the last new group of amateur cooks competing for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final. As usual, they begin by showing off their culinary skills with a single plate of food, before rustling up a dish in the invention test from either the sweet box, containing pineapple, white chocolate, digestives, pecan nuts, creme fraiche and sherry, or the savoury box, which has rabbit, smoked haddock, bacon, curly kale, vine tomatoes, baby turnips and leeks inside. After two hopefuls are shown the door, the rest cook a two-course meal for three guests - 2009 MasterChef champion Mat Follas, as well as previous finalists Andy Oliver and Tom Whitaker - before Gregg Wallace and John decide who will progress in the contest.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate Britain's love of seafood and the plentiful and diverse supply of produce obtained from local waters. They also explore the history of Billingsgate Market in east London, the country's largest inland fish market.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MasterChef judge continues to explore Queensland, visiting a tropical fruit farm and meeting a chef who has transformed Bush tucker into haute cuisine.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including oysters, whelks, mangos, white chocolate and dates. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining amateur cooks' tart-making abilities are put to the test in the third round of the competition. Their first task is to bake a tarte Tatin, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry looking for intriguing flavour combinations to tickle their tastebuds. The hopefuls then face another daunting technical challenge as they try to replicate Mary's seemingly straightforward recipe for treacle tart, but the delicate task of adding a lattice top leaves some contestants flummoxed. Finally, they try to create an ornate fruit tart fit for gracing the window display of a leading patisserie - before discovering the identities of the latest Star Baker and the person who will be heading home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's Singapore chilli crab, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the dish and write down what they think the ingredients are. It's a tricky recipe with a fiery chilli and black-bean paste that also requires them to prepare and cook a whole crab. Can they rise to the challenge? They then rustle up a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Kate Spicer, before finding out who has made it through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin returns to his secondary school, Malton, where he failed his cookery GCSE, in this week's back-to-basics-themed episode. He visits Morfudd Richards to discover the secret of her home-made organic ice-creams taking the market by storm, and meets the couple who found success by introducing crumble recipes into French cooking.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King explore the history behind the boom in pub food, tracing it from the humble beginnings of bar snacks and chicken-in-a-basket to the birth of the gastro pub. The duo also recreate some mouthwatering dishes that would make any publican proud.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use this power to bring about the fall of his female boss. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: Jennifer Eight
programme.desc: Bruce Robinson's dark thriller stars Andy Garcia as John Berlin, a burnt-out LA cop who takes a job in the small town of Eureka, where his brother-in-law Freddy Ross is a local cop. Within days, he's involved in the hunt for a serial killer who targets blind women and Berlin thinks he knows who the next target is - Helena Robertson. But as Berlin gets close to both cracking the case, and falls for Helena, FBI agent St Anne arrives on the scene with a new suspect - Berlin himself..(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institutes's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: Lena has just moved to the small, Southern town of Gatlin, where the only person who seems to understand her -- or dream of bigger places or ideas -- is a cute guy named Ethan Wate (Alden Ehrenreich), who recognizes her instantly from the cryptic dreams he's been having every night. Lena is an orphan, and she's come to stay with her mysterious uncle, Macon Ravenwood (Irons), the patriarch of her powerful family. Powerful, because The Ravenwood clan are Casters, born with powers that ordinary mortals don't have, like the ability to move objects, control the elements, and even step out of normal space and time to communicate only with each other. But just as Lena feels ready to open up to Ethan, she discovers that their love is in imminent danger, because when female Casters turn 16, their destiny as either good or evil is revealed. Unwilling to let her nature be dictated by forces outside her control, Lena and Ethan set out together to uncover the strange, secret lore of their families' intertwined histories dating back to the Civil War, and figure out how to grant Lena the power to choose her own destiny(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men

programme.title: Le Divorce

However, her arrival coincides with Watts' husband walking out to live with his Russian mistress. Hudson, forced to stay in Paris, falls in love with the city and begins an ultimately unsatisfying adulterous affair with an older man, coldly observed by her employee Glenn Close, who also had an affair with Lhermitte(n)

programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Messy as F**k. Molly lines up a date with a promising prospect after treating herself to a day at the salon. Meanwhile, Issa isn't sure how she feels about Lawrence, who tries to make amends for forgetting her birthday(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Jamal Woolard stars in George Tillman Jr's biopic of Brooklyn rapper Biggie Smalls, aka The Notorious B.I.G. (and better know by his mother Voletta - who co-produced the movie - as Christopher Wallace). Early on, the young Smalls shows interest in writing and performing rap with his friends, but he drifts into a life of drug dealing instead. Smalls' fortunes look to improve when a demo tape of his music is noticed by big-time producer Sean Combs (who also co-produced the movie, and is played by Derek Luke). Combs signs the rapper to his Uptown Records label, on the understanding that Smalls will forsake his narcotics activities. Director Tillman Jr goes on to track the nascent recording star's trajectory from this promising start, through his constant philandering, his love/ hate relationship with West Coast rapper Tupac Shakur and on to the bitter, ultimately homicidal, rivalry between the East and West Coast rap scenes, which was to bring to an abrupt, permanent end to both men's careers. Also starring Angela Bassett(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: This drama examines the fight between good and evil among an American infantry platoon in the jungles of Vietnam(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Writer Joaquin Phoenix begins a relationship with his hyper-intelligent computer (voiced by Scarlett Johansson). Oscar-winning romance. Strong language/sex/flashing images(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.sub-title: Love Is the Weapon of Choice
programme.desc: Love Is the Weapon of Choice. Bret and Jemaine become rivals for the attentions of the same woman, who happens to have an epileptic dog that has gone missing(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen (Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Lizzy Caplan, and Dave Franco) return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul named Walter Mabry (Daniel Radcliffe). However, Mabry soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him. Directed by Jon M. Chu (G.I. Joe: Retaliation)(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use this power to bring about the fall of his female boss. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: Ben Affleck and Josh Hartnett star in a WWII blockbuster from the director of Transformers. A US pilot travels to Britain to fight in the war just before the Japanese attack(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A self-help author comes home for a visit and finds his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher in this crude farce(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 161. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Insecure as F**k. Two black women who are best friends navigate the pitfalls of their personal and professional lives in south Los Angeles in this comedy, which begins with Issa wondering if her relationship with her boyfriend is still worth the effort, while Molly's success as an attorney barely masks her dissatisfaction with her romantic prospects(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Witch Queen, who has returned from the dead, in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: Inconsolable, a young mother is determined to bring her son back from the dead through an ancient ritual. She travels to a temple and finds a door that serves as a portal between two worlds, but disregards a sacred warning and unleashes evil in the form of her son(n)

programme.title: Jennifer Eight
programme.desc: Bruce Robinson's dark thriller stars Andy Garcia as John Berlin, a burnt-out LA cop who takes a job in the small town of Eureka, where his brother-in-law Freddy Ross is a local cop. Within days, he's involved in the hunt for a serial killer who targets blind women and Berlin thinks he knows who the next target is - Helena Robertson. But as Berlin gets close to both cracking the case, and falls for Helena, FBI agent St Anne arrives on the scene with a new suspect - Berlin himself..(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institutes's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: Lena has just moved to the small, Southern town of Gatlin, where the only person who seems to understand her -- or dream of bigger places or ideas -- is a cute guy named Ethan Wate (Alden Ehrenreich), who recognizes her instantly from the cryptic dreams he's been having every night. Lena is an orphan, and she's come to stay with her mysterious uncle, Macon Ravenwood (Irons), the patriarch of her powerful family. Powerful, because The Ravenwood clan are Casters, born with powers that ordinary mortals don't have, like the ability to move objects, control the elements, and even step out of normal space and time to communicate only with each other. But just as Lena feels ready to open up to Ethan, she discovers that their love is in imminent danger, because when female Casters turn 16, their destiny as either good or evil is revealed. Unwilling to let her nature be dictated by forces outside her control, Lena and Ethan set out together to uncover the strange, secret lore of their families' intertwined histories dating back to the Civil War, and figure out how to grant Lena the power to choose her own destiny(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Longtime rivals compete for the attentions of a widow, their alluring new neighbour; but they may have to reconcile when their adult children become attracted to one another(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: James Ivory and Ismail Merchant's drama, written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala, stars Kate Hudson, who flies to Paris to visit her pregnant stepsister Naomi Watts. However, her arrival coincides with Watts' husband walking out to live with his Russian mistress. Hudson, forced to stay in Paris, falls in love with the city and begins an ultimately unsatisfying adulterous affair with an older man, coldly observed by her employee Glenn Close, who also had an affair with Lhermitte(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez stars in this true story of Texas born singer Selena Quintanilla-Perez, who rose from cult status to becoming one of the biggest stars in Latin Music(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: Adaptation of the graphic novel set in 1985 America, where a cadre of forced-into-retirement superheroes investigate the murder of one of their own and uncover a wide-ranging conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 162. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Behind the Candelabra
programme.desc: The story of flamboyant musician Liberace's tempestuous relationship with his much younger lover Scott Thorson(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a security guard who, having been the sole survivor of a high-fatality train crash, finds himself at the centre of a mysterious theory that explains his consistent physical good fortune. When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: Freeman is hired to chauffeur the difficult Tandy in racially tense 1960's South. The two develop an eventual relationship and love for each other with terrific performances across the board and enough sincerity to break even the toughest audience(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Based on the first volume in Philip Pullman's best-selling, award-winning trilogy, His Dark Materials, THE GOLDEN COMPASS unfolds an epic fantasy adventure set in a parallel world, where science and magic intertwine. Twelve-year-old Lyra Belacqua (played by newcomer Dakota Blue Richards) sets out to rescue her best friend, and ends up on an extraordinary quest to save not only her own world, but ours and others as well. Academy Award winner Nicole Kidman and stars with Daniel Craig in this triumph of the imagination. Filled with fascination, depth and wonder, Pullman's saga presents the eternal struggle of good vs. evil -- and the power of one young girl heal a rift torn in the fabric of the universe(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: An accountant is pulled into the deadly world of espionage by his former nerdy classmate who is now a CIA assassin(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young driver, Speed Racer, aspires to be champion of the racing world with the help of his family and his high-tech Mach 5 automobile(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: A college dropout gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it sounds(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying friends Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Electrifying chronicle of the seminal rap group N.W.A. and their 'hood-to-riches success, tracing their story from the mean streets of mid-'80s Compton to their triumphant battles against censorship(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Alien-hunting agents hunt extraterrestrials bent on destroying Earth in this sequel(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves plays Jack Traven, a young cop working with the LAPD bomb squad. Thwarting mad bomber Howard Payne, who has wired up a lift to explode, Traven finds himself the object of revenge. Payne rigs a bomb to a bus which arms when the speed reaches above 50mph and explodes if it drops beneath. With passenger Annie Porter drafted in to replace the injured driver, Traven has to work out how to disarm the bomb and evacuate the passengers while she keeps the bus up to speed in urban LA. Jan de Bont's thriller piles on the action and even after Traven saves everyone on the bus, there's still a roller-coaster finale on a runaway subway train commandeered by Payne(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: Undersea suspense drama. The world stands at the brink of war after a Russian nationalist seizes control of a nuclear missile base. On board a US nuclear submarine, tensions between the captain and his new first officer are heightened when a confusing message is received. The resulting quarrel about whether or not to launch missiles divides the crew and leads to mutiny(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once again send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but Lee's shock at coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower. Also starring Youki Kudoh and Noémie Lenoir, together with, in unlikely cameos, Max von Sydow and Roman Polanski(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Part of More4's Indian week, Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Gothic horror story set in modern-day San Francisco about a two-hundred-year-old vampire who decides to reveal all about his existence to an increasingly beguiled tabloid journalist. Weary with wandering the world in search of fresh prey, the blood-sucking fiend takes time out to recall vignettes from a past life that embraces two centuries and four continents(n)

With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: Undersea suspense drama. The world stands at the brink of war after a Russian nationalist seizes control of a nuclear missile base. On board a US nuclear submarine, tensions between the captain and his new first officer are heightened when a confusing message is received. The resulting quarrel about whether or not to launch missiles divides the crew and leads to mutiny(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once again send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but Lee's shock at coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower. Also starring Youki Kudoh and Noémie Lenoir, together with, in unlikely cameos, Max von Sydow and Roman Polanski(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: A comic battle of wills ensues when five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam in 1968 grudgingly agree to undertake the mission of a life-time - to secretly transport an 8,000 lib elephant through 200 miles of jungle! Comic chaos is the result of this effort to foster goodwill with the locals, as the mis-matched bunch of soldiers take on their jumbo task!(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Back in the late 1970s, author Cameron Crowe banked upon his youthful appearance to pose as a teen-aged high school student. The results of his hands-on research was the revelatory book Fast Times at Ridgemont High, which went on to spectacular success as a theatrical feature. The sociological inner lining of Crowe's book was sacrificed in favor of standard teen-movie dialogue and Animal House-style comedy, but the film is impossible to dislike, and it spawned a legion of future imitators. Ostensibly, the main characters are brother and sister Jennifer Jason Leigh and Judge Reinhold. However, the real breakthrough star is Sean Penn as the perpetually zoned-out Jeff Spicoli. It is Penn who has the film's most famous scene, wherein the decorum of teacher Hand (Ray Walston)'s classroom is interrupted by a pizza delivery. Fast Times at Ridgemont High was spun off into a TV series, the short-lived 1986 weekly Fast Times(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie

Recorded during a live appearance at Los Angeles' Henry Ford Theater, Tracey Ullman: Live & Exposed documents a solo show in which Ullman talks about her childhood, her first steps into show business, her first big break in British television, and her rise to fame, pausing along the way to talk about how some of her best-known characters came to be(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Kirsten Sheridan's family drama stars Freddie Highmore as Evan Taylor, a musical prodigy searching for his parents. When pregnant cellist Lyla Novacek was hit by a car, her controlling father and manager told her she'd lost the baby; in reality she gave birth prematurely and her father sent the infant to an orphanage. Eleven years later, when Evan finds out that his parents are alive, he sets out to find them, taking inspiration from the music around him. The heart of the film is Evan's almost mystical ability to 'feel' music, a challenging concept that is rendered believable thanks to inventive work from the composer of the main score, Mark Mancina. Also starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Evan's rock singer father, and Robin Williams as a modern-day Fagin who Evan meets during his search for his family(n)

She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? programme.title: Dr. Dolittle 3
programme.desc: A young woman discovers that her father's special talent runs in the family in this direct-to-video sequel to the 1998 blockbuster (which, unlike the previous two films in the series, does not feature Eddie Murphy). Maya Dolittle (Kyla Pratt), the youngest daughter of veterinarian John Dolittle, makes the surprising discovery that, like her dad, she can understand what animals have to say, and speak with them in their own language. Unlike her father, Maya hasn't found a suitable use for her talents, and as she finds an outlet for her unique language skills, she is sent away to Durango, a combination summer camp and dude ranch, where she strikes up a rapport with both the fellow campers and the livestock. When she learns that Durango is on the verge of going out of business due to money problems, Maya starts working with the camp's horses and cattle, giving them a much needed pep talk as they're entered in a local rodeo that could save Durango. Dr. Dolittle 3: The Daughter Is In also features Kristen Wilson, John Amos, and Walker Howard(n)

John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: Eva Longoria Parker, Paul Rudd, and Lake Bell star in first-time feature filmmaker Jeff Lowell's heavenly romantic comedy concerning a female psychic and a doubtful skeptic who find their fledgling love affair thwarted by the latter's recently deceased fiancée. Henry (Rudd) and Kate (Longoria Parker) were all prepared to live out their "happily ever after" when tragedy struck from out of nowhere and Kate was killed on their wedding day. In the aftermath of the accident, a devastated Paul reluctantly takes his sister's advice and pays a visit to local psychic Ashley (Bell). Now, despite the fact that he openly questions her ability to communicate with the dearly departed, Paul can't help but fall head over heels in love with Ashley. Despite the fact that the feelings are most certainly mutual, however, their growing relationship is threatened when Kate makes it her supernatural mission to sabotage the happy couple's fledgling relationship before it starts to get serious(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: The director of the Academy Award-winning 2006 crime drama Tsotsi returns to the helm with this tale of a Middle East CIA operative who begins to have doubts about his latest assignment after witnessing the interrogation of a suspected suicide bomber by secret police. When Egyptian-born chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi (Omar Metwally) mysteriously vanishes on a routine flight from South Africa to Washington, his wife, Isabella (Reese Witherspoon), embarks on a frantic international search for her missing husband. At the same time, a CIA analyst (Jake Gyllenhaal) arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. As the interrogation of El-Ibrahimi gets under way, the CIA analyst is profoundly shaken by the unorthodox methods used by the man's captors, and quickly begins to reevaluate his assignment. Peter Sarsgaard, Meryl Streep, and Alan Arkin co-star in this topical political thriller penned by Kelley Sane and produced by Steve Golin(n)

programme.title: Sinister 2
programme.desc: In this chilling sequel, two young brothers must defend themselves against a malevolent spirit that feeds on the corruption of innocence, and that documents its exploits in home movies(n)

There, a deadly virus has been unleashed, killing the lab's personnel and resurrecting them as the evil Un-Dead(n)

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: Harrison Ford gives an intense, brooding performance as District Attorney Rusty Sabich in the late Alan J Pakula's lugubrious adaptation of Scott Turow's best-selling mystery novel. Assigned to investigate the brutal rape and murder of his legal colleague and one-time lover Carolyn Polhemus, Sabich's life is turned upside-down when all the evidence uncovered points to him being the killer(n)

programme.title: Tashi and the Monk
programme.desc: A visit to a home for orphans and abandoned children in northeastern India that was founded by a former Buddhist monk, who's reminded of his own troubled childhood by an unruly new arrival(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: A charming 1960s con man poses as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer while eluding a dogged FBI agent who is determined to put him behind bars. Later, the swindler falls in love with the daughter of the District Attorney of New Orleans, Louisiana(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: After the highly acclaimed independent film Bottle Rocket, director Wes Anderson followed up with a quirky Touchstone Studios film entitled Rushmore. Written by Anderson and friend Owen Wilson (an actor in Armageddon and Anaconda), they created the story of Max Fischer, a highly eccentric 15-year-old boy who attends the tenth grade at Rushmore Academy. Played by Jason Schwartzman (Talia Shire's son and Francis Ford Coppola's nephew), Max is a poor student with big dreams and a love of extracurricular activities. Max is editor of the school newspaper and yearbook, president of the chess, astronomy, French, and German clubs, captain of the fencing team, and director of the school play. Max is also a compulsive liar, telling everyone that his barber father (Seymour Cassel) is really a brain surgeon. Suddenly Max falls in love with Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a first-grade teacher at the school. He also makes a new friend in business tycoon Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), an eccentric millionaire who also loves Miss Cross. The love triangle heats up as Max refuses to believe that his age has anything to do with Miss Cross refusing his romantic advances. Also Max's scheme to erect an aquarium on the school baseball diamond gets him booted out of Rushmore Academy. As his life crumbles around him, he is forced to grow up and accept the consequences of his actions and his lies. He throws himself more into his extracurricular activities, hoping to redeem himself by staging the most ambitious school play ever attempted(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Julia Roberts won the Academy Award® for Best Actress, among five nominations for this stirring, funny and unconventional drama based on real events. Erin Brockovich is in a tight spot following a car accident, though not her fault, her attorney, Ed Masry, fails to land her a settlement. With no money, no job and no prospects, Erin pleads with Ed to hire her at his law firm. There she discovers a cover-up involving contaminated water that's causing devastating illnesses in a local community. By dogged determination and the ability to speak their language, Erin ultimately earns the trust of the locals and signs up more than 600 plaintiffs. Erin and Ed go on to win the largest settlement ever paid in a direct-action lawsuit in U.S. history(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Steven Soderbergh's re-make of the classic Andrei Torkovsky film stars George Clooney as the therapist sent to mentor a group of astronauts on the Prometheus space station, where the remaining crew are both locked in their own fears, speaking of visions of lost loved ones. At first sceptical, when Clooney's lost wife appears to him, he begins to wonder what influence the mysterious planet Solaris has on the human psyche(n)

programme.title: Making 'Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising'
programme.desc: A look at "Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising," a sequel to the 2014 comedy that finds a young couple plagued by yet another Greek menace: the sisters of Kappa Kappa Nu. The film stars Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Chloë Grace Moretz, and is directed by Nicholas Stoller(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: Grey Gardens
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore and Jessica Lange star in this captivating drama recounting the true story of 'Big' Edie and 'Little' Edie Beale. The mother and daughter, relations of Jackie Onassis, were prominent figures on the New York social scene, before their lives took a very different turn. Retreating to their summer home, Grey Gardens, the women became eccentric recluses, until film-makers Albert and David Maysles visit the crumbling mansion to capture their fascinating story on film(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Meets the Playboy. Monk (Tony Shalhoub) is called in to investigate the supposedly accidental" death of of Elliot D'Souza (Mark Tymchyshyn), chief financial officer for the notorious girlie magazine "Sapphire". Elliot's secretary Miss Luden (Fay Masterson) is convinced that he was murdered by Sapphire's publisher Dexter Larsen (Gary Cole)--who, naturally, has the usual airtight alibi. Complicating matters so far as Monk is concerned is the fact that his nurse-assistant Sharona (Bitty Schram) once posed nude for "Sapphire" and is trying to keep this secret from her son. And then there's the curious omnipresence of Dexter's current house guest...Danny Bonaduce!(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the 12th Man. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Missing Granny
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Missing Granny. The grandmother of law student Julie Parlo (Rachel Dratch) is kidnapped, apparently by a long-dormant 1970s radical group called the Lightning Brigade. Though grandma is returned unharmed, Julie asks Monk (Tony Shalhoub) to locate the old woman's abductors, promising to get him reinstated to the plice force as he does so. Monk's investigation leads him to a pair of pretentious antique dealers, Harold and Carol Maloney (Currie Graham, Eden Rountree)--but since their only likely "motive" involves a stolen cat (a fact that sets the highly allergic Monk to sneezing even before he meets the feline!), they hardly seem capable of being kidnappers or even former radicals. As usual, however, there's more to the case the meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Monk

programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Captain's Wife. Karen Stottlemeyer (Glenne Headly), the wife of police captain Lance Stottlemeyer (Ted Levine), is seriously injured in a car accident caused by a sniper who may have been involved in a local labor dispute. Captain Stottlemeyer's ability to handle the case is compromised when he has a violent confrontation with union boss Harry Bolston (Geoff Pierson), so Monk (Tony Shalhoub) takes over the investigation. As it turns out, the solution to the case appears in the unlikely form of a stray dog that Sharona (Bitty Schram) has picked up at the scene of the shooting--but simply knowing that the dog's owner and the gunman are one and the same does not mean that Monk will be able to prove it(n)

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: In this sophomoric comedy, an immature twenty-something party animal must take over his father's multi-million dollar hotel business after his father retires, but first he must return to school. Billy Madison loves to drink beer, hang with his friends and play childish pranks. However, his father's retirement is forcing him to grow up. The filthy rich heir has never been ambitious; in fact, he bribed his way through school. To gain control of his father's company, the child-like Billy must cram 12 years of learning into 24 weeks. If he fails, the company reigns will be passed to his father's slimy aide. Naturally the aide wants Billy to fail and engineers many insidious plots(n)

programme.desc: Dev is gutted when Erica spoils his plans for an afternoon of pampering, unaware that she is off to meet Kevin, and Neil tells Bethany to lie to Sarah and pretend she made the whole thing up. Meanwhile, Liz tells Steve she's landed herself a new job at the medical centre.(n)

programme.title: Fearless
programme.desc: As Kevin fights for his life in hospital, the US air force lets Emma meet in secret with Logan, who tells her he was in a relationship with Linda before her death and reveals that the pair were introduced at the air base by her Uncle Phil. Meanwhile, DCS Greenwood phones Heather to request that Emma be returned to the UK so she can be arrested for conspiracy, Dominic visits Miriam in prison and Matthew Wild rallies support as he prepares for the leadership election. Thriller, starring Helen McCrory and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: The broadcaster meets Florida woman Jennifer Mee who, as a teenager, became a media sensation when she suffered a particularly strange ailment - a persistent case of hiccups. But in 2010, she lured an innocent man to a dark alleyway where her friends were waiting to rob him. Instead he ended up being shot dead. Even though she didn't pull the trigger, and was nowhere near when the bullets were fired, Jennifer was sentenced to life without parole. Piers charts the journey through fame and rejection that saw Jennifer descend into a criminal lifestyle, and asks family members and legal experts if they believe her punishment was too harsh.(n)

programme.title: The Kyle Files
programme.desc: Jeremy Kyle heads to Norwich to investigate the dangers of a night out in Britain, joining paramedics on a busy shift, as well as volunteers who look after those who have had too much to drink. programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is found strangled. programme.title: Davina McCall: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: Davina travels to the Azores in the mid-Atlantic to investigate how animals cope with with atmospheric pressure changes underwater, particularly the ones that have to take in air before they submerge. She swims with a school of dolphins and finds out about the inbuilt response that both animals and humans have when they go underwater, and meets a world champion freediver who teaches her the techniques needed to swim alongside sperm whales, before trying to overcome her nerves and dive down to the ocean floor on a single breath.(n)

The seven-week series promises fun for all the family and some hilarious physical games alongside head-to-head quizzes and traditional panel show material, and with the show being filmed closed to transmission, there will also be plenty of topical elements. programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. programme.desc: A blood-spattered hotel room and a stolen credit card lead Ronnie and Joe to Charles Hutton, a member of the wealthy upper classes who dotes on his wife Camille and daughter Georgia. The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jake's old nemesis. As the evidence stacks up, how far will Charles go to protect his privileged family? Guest starring James Wilby and Joseph Millson.(n)

programme.title: The Street

Then, when the job is finished, he unwinds in a gay bar and is attacked by a homophobic thug - losing his wallet in the process. Not wanting police involvement, he goes home with no money, but eventually comes clean about a sexual encounter with a fellow worker and his world collapses around him. Vincent Regan and Julia Ford star, with Will Mellor.(n)

Co-starring Sophia Myles, Damian Lewis, Laurence Fox, and Guy Henry.(n)

Maurice hopes his friends will make the sober weekend enjoyable - unaware he'll be expected to complete a series of bizarre challenges if he's to claim his inheritance. With Neil Pearson, Mark Benton and Anne Reid.(n)

programme.desc: When a series of shootings claims one of their own, Ronnie and Joe have little time to grieve - they must solve the case before the killer reaches their next target on a hit list that includes CPS director Henry Sharpe. It gradually becomes apparent that the common thread connecting all the names is the case of Mark Glendon, convicted of the murder of his wife four years earlier. Although he's still in custody, a retrial is imminent, putting pressure on the team to catch the murderer before the jury delivers its verdict.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The members of an Oxford old boys' cricket team gather for their annual match, unaware that death is waiting at the crease to bowl one of them out for good. Morse sets out to find the culprit - helped as ever by the faithful Lewis, who demonstrates unexpected skill on the pitch. Meanwhile, Bailey and Alex's difficult case is further complicated by the patient's schizophrenic son. Jodie: Adrienne Barbeau. Olivia: Sarah Utterback(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Tainted Obligation. Meredith must treat her father, Thatcher (Jeff Perry), who's suffering from liver failure; Izzie empathizes with a tumor-riddled patient; and Mark tricks Cristina into assisting on an unusual surgery because he's annoyed with her competitive nature. Irving Waller: Ralph Waite(n)

programme.title: Derailed
programme.desc: A clandestine love affair may claim a terrible price from two desperate people in this psychological thriller. Charles Schine (Clive Owen) is an advertising executive who is married to Deanna (Melissa George) and has a young diabetic daughter whose third kidney operation has just failed. Charles' life turns a most unexpected corner when he meets Lucinda Harris (Jennifer Aniston) on a commuter train. Lucinda, who is also married with a daughter, keeps bumping into Charles on the train, and they strike up a friendship that soon grows into something deeper. Eventually Charles and Lucinda meet for lunch, then dinner, then check into a posh hotel, but the consequences turn out to be greater than they imagined; the dangerous criminal Philippe LaRoche (Vincent Cassel) breaks into the couple's hotel room, beats Charles nearly unconscious, and rapes Lucinda. The problem doesn't end there, however; LaRoche soon unveils both his certainty that the couple avoided calling the police, and -- more troublingly -- his possession of Charles' personal information. When he makes the ill-advised attempt to blackmail the couple, Charles turns to a rough-cut friend from his workplace, who offers to help out -- for a small commission.Derailed was the first American project for Swedish filmmaker Mikael Håfström(n)
