programme.title: Halloween
programme.desc: Rocker Rob Zombie directed this terrifying reimagining of John Carpenter's seminal 1978 slasher film about a psycho killer who escapes from a psychiatric facility and goes on a bloody rampage on Halloween night(n)

programme.title: Blue Crush
programme.desc: A former pro surfer trying to get back into competition falls for a football star(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Minds
programme.desc: An ex-marine is recruited to teach an inner-city class full of toughs. Based on actual events(n)

programme.title: Fair Haven
programme.desc: This searing drama centers on a young man who is struggling to understand his sexuality after he is forced to endure gay-conversion therapy. In time, he must choose between the demands of his close-minded father and the desires of his heart(n)

programme.title: Forsaken
programme.desc: In 1872 Wyoming, a Civil War veteran-turned-gunslinger (Kiefer Sutherland) must make amends with his estranged father (Donald Sutherland), a reverend who deplores his son's embrace of violence, as he tries to protect his hometown from ruthless land-grabbers. Jon Cassar directed this menacing Western, which also stars Demi Moore and Brian Cox. Forsaken received its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Grosse Pointe Blank
programme.desc: A successful hit man re-evaluates his profession while attending his high-school reunion(n)

programme.title: Assault on Precinct 13
programme.desc: Jean-François Richet's re-make of John Carpenter's 1976 cult classic rivals the original for tension and action. Ethan Hawke plays Jake Roenick, a police sergeant in charge of closing down defunct cop shop Precinct 13 with old timer Jasper O'Shea and secretary Iris Ferry. But a bus taking drugs lord Marion Bishop to prison is caught up in traffic chaos and he and the other prisoners are dumped on Roenick and his team. Bishop is due to give evidence that would expose cop corruption at the highest level and when Marcus Duvall, one of those under threat, finds out where Bishop is being held, he gathers a gang to take him out. And only Roenick and his rag-bag of cons, cops and civilians can stop them(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: A retiring safecracker considers one last heist, but his partners may be trickier than any combination he's ever solved. A slick, involving caper. Robert De Niro, Edward Norton, Marlon Brando. Jazz artists Cassandra Wilson and Mose Allison appear in cameos. Frank Oz directed(n)

programme.title: It Follows
programme.desc: In this relentless and innovative horror film, a 19-year-old woman contracts a sexually transmitted curse after a one-night stand with a handsome stranger. Terrorized by malevolent phantoms, she turns to her friends to find a way out of this nightmare(n)

programme.title: Twin Peaks: The Return
programme.desc: 109. It's happening again(n)

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Home Sweet Homeless Shelter. Kevin, Veronica and Svetlana start a topless maid service; Frank makes new friends at the shelter to replace his family; Debbie's new lifestyle comes to an abrupt end; Carl gets a syphilis scare; Ian struggles with a breakup; business at Patsy's hits the skids(n)

programme.title: I'm Dying Up Here
programme.desc: The Return. Goldie pitches an idea her lover/lawyer Eli believes he can sell; Nick returns to Goldie's after a long and mysterious hiatus; Adam begins a new handyman job and quickly learns there is more to the gig than was promised; Ralph is visited by a Vietnam buddy(n)

programme.title: The Bank Job
programme.desc: It's the cockney gang who couldn't think straight when a team of inept thieves tunnels into a London vault in 1971 and steals a fortune from safe-deposit boxes, but winds up with more than they expected. Clever, fact-based caper escapade starring Jason Statham as a hardened working-class bloke who sees the heist as a way out of his troubled financial situation. Saffron Burrows costars as the femme fatale who puts the plan in motion. David Mays, David Suchet. Directed by Roger Donaldson(n)

programme.title: I'm Dying Up Here

programme.title: Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: An engaged couple take their friends on a pre-wedding party getaway that turns murderous as guests are killed off one at a time(n)

programme.title: The Final Cut
programme.desc: Robin Williams gives a powerful performance in this riveting sci-fi thriller about a world where memory implants record all the moments of a person's life. Williams plays a troubled "cutter" who edits together the footage for funerals. Omar Naim directed and wrote the script. Mira Sorvino, Jim Caviezel(n)

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: In this historical drama set during the Cold War, an attorney is tasked with negotiating a prisoner exchange between an American pilot who was shot down over the USSR and a Soviet spy serving a 45-year sentence for espionage against the US(n)

programme.desc: Biopic of Edward Snowden, the former CIA contractor who leaked classified information from the US National Security Agency in 2013(n)

programme.desc: It's the cockney gang who couldn't think straight when a team of inept thieves tunnels into a London vault in 1971 and steals a fortune from safe-deposit boxes, but winds up with more than they expected. Clever, fact-based caper escapade starring Jason Statham as a hardened working-class bloke who sees the heist as a way out of his troubled financial situation. programme.title: Assault on Precinct 13
programme.desc: Jean-François Richet's re-make of John Carpenter's 1976 cult classic rivals the original for tension and action. Ethan Hawke plays Jake Roenick, a police sergeant in charge of closing down defunct cop shop Precinct 13 with old timer Jasper O'Shea and secretary Iris Ferry. But a bus taking drugs lord Marion Bishop to prison is caught up in traffic chaos and he and the other prisoners are dumped on Roenick and his team. Bishop is due to give evidence that would expose cop corruption at the highest level and when Marcus Duvall, one of those under threat, finds out where Bishop is being held, he gathers a gang to take him out. And only Roenick and his rag-bag of cons, cops and civilians can stop them(n)

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story
programme.desc: Relegated to a forlorn afterlife of unsmiling lost souls and melancholy drifters as a result of committing suicide in the mortal realm, a heartbroken young man sets out to find the girl who inspired his final act of self-destruction after learning that she too has taken her own life in director Goran Dukic's adaptation of Etgar Keret's darkly comic novella Kneller's Happy Campers. A likeable young man despite his depressive disposition, Zia (Patrick Fugit) puts blade to wrist only to find that the pain of life doesn't end with the coming of death. Now trapped in a bleak metaphysical landscape populated entirely by suicide victims blearily searching for the joys that eluded them in the physical realm, Zia soon learns that the love is one of the latest arrivals in the dreary land of the dead. As Zia sets out to locate his ill-fated former companion and experience the joys that eluded the couple in life, he is joined in his quest by a lovelorn Russian rocker named Eugene (Shea Wigham) and an accidental tourist named Mikal (Shannyn Sossamon), who's looking for a way out of the sorrowful stir(n)

programme.title: Blood Sand
programme.desc: After an all-night beach party, a group of friends wake up to find some of them are missing, and the survivors think that they might be victims of a flesh-eating creature hiding in the sand(n)

programme.title: The Spirit
programme.desc: A resurrected cop does battle with a villain whose quest for immortality threatens an entire metropolis in Sin City creator Frank Miller's adaptation of Will Eisner's acclaimed graphic novel. When a rookie cop is brutally killed and mysteriously brought back to life, he assumes the guise of The Spirit (Gabriel Macht) -- a masked crime fighter who prowls the shadows of Central City on a supernatural mission to keep the urban landscape safe. Upon discovering that his arch nemesis, The Octopus (Samuel L. Jackson), is determined to live forever even if it means wiping out the entire population of Central City, The Spirit must race to stop the diabolical villain from achieving his cold-blooded plan. But even with his unique powers, the brave masked crusader will face a series of deadly challenges as a bevy of treacherous beauties including deceptively sweet girl next door Ellen Dolan (Sarah Paulson), spitfire secretary Silken Floss (Scarlett Johansson), wraithlike siren Lorelei (Jaime King), seductive policewoman Morgenstern (Stana Katic), and French black widow Plaster of Paris (Paz Vega) set out to seduce or consume him at every turn; even The Spirit's one true love, a volatile jewel thief named Sand Saref (Eva Mendes), could ultimately destroy our hero before he accomplishes his mission of saving Central City(n)

programme.title: Out of the Furnace
programme.desc: A Rust Belt ex-con seeks redemption by avenging his brother's murder in this drama from Crazy Heart writer/director Scott Cooper. The glimmer of a better life always just out of reach, Russell Baze (Christian Bale) dreams of starting a family with his girlfriend Lena (Zoe Saldana), and resolves to earn an honest living working in the same mill where his dying father did. Meanwhile, Russell's volatile younger brother Rodney (Casey Affleck) decides to serve his country by fighting in Iraq. Despite Russell's best intentions, however, his future starts to look grim when he is sent to prison following a deadly drunk-driving accident; at the same time, Rodney begins competing in illegal fights for local bar owner John Petty (Willem Dafoe), who owes a sizable debt to the very dangerous Harlan DeGroat (Woody Harrelson), a fight organizer/meth dealer who's way too into his own product. Later, after Russell is released from prison having missed his father's funeral, he is heartbroken to learn that Lena has become seriously involved with the local police chief, Wesley Barnes (Forest Whitaker). But heartache turns to anger when the desperate Rodney also gets mixed up with DeGroat, and winds up dead along with John Petty. Informed by Chief Barnes that Rodney's body has been found by a hunter, Russell, believing he has nothing to lose, recruits his loyal uncle Red (Sam Shepard) to help him seek revenge(n)

programme.title: Dirty Weekend
programme.desc: Neil LaBute wrote and directed this kinky comedy-drama, about two colleagues who explore their sexuality over the course of a long layover. Stuck in Albuquerque during a business trip, Les (Matthew Broderick) and Natalie (Alice Eve) decide to get out of the airport and see the sights. While Natalie considers cheating on her partner, Les investigates a drunken affair he had the last time he was in the city -- only he doesn't remember if it was with a man or a woman. Dirty Weekend made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur
programme.desc: Walt Disney Pictures redefined computer animation with this technically accomplished fantasy of prehistoric life, combining live-action backgrounds with computer-generated animals. After a pterodactyl snatches a dinosaur's egg and accidentally drops it while flying away, the egg is rescued by a family of lemurs, who keep it warm until it hatches. They raise the baby dinosaur, named Aladar, as one of their own, and as he grows to adulthood, Aladar protects the primates that he has come to regard as his family. When a giant meteor appears in the sky, packs of dinosaurs have no idea what to make of the strange fiery light, but Aladar and the lemurs are convinced that they must escape to a safer place before the huge flaming stone destroys their home, leading Aladar to encounter his own kind for the first time. D.B. Sweeney provides the voice of Aladar; other actors in the voice cast include Joan Plowright, Julianna Margulies, Alfre Woodard, and Ossie Davis(n)

programme.title: Captivity
programme.desc: Vatel director Roland Joffé teams with screenwriters Larry Cohen and Joseph Tura to adapt an original story by Cohen concerning a fashion model (Elisha Cuthbert) and her chauffeur, who are kidnapped and held captive by a sadistic serial killer. Jennifer Tree (Cuthbert) is America's sweetheart; a top fashion model and ubiquitous cover girl who is adored by millions, Jennifer possesses all of the wealth and power that comes with being a natural, world-class beauty. Every girl wants to be Jennifer, and every man wants to have her -- one more than all others combined. That man has been lying in wait for precisely the right moment to strike, and when Jennifer makes the fateful mistake of stepping out on her own at a Soho charity event, he finally sees the opportunity to take possession of his most prized object. Drugged, taken, and placed in a cell, where she is forced to endure unspeakable mental and physical torture, Jennifer struggles against her twisted tormentor with every ounce of courage and fight that she has -- but will it be enough for her to endure should her captor continue to maintain the upper hand? A controversial film long before it ever went into wide release, Captivity caused quite a stir when graphic, unapproved ads for the film appeared on billboards and taxicabs in New York and Los Angeles. Though representatives from Captivity's releasing company After Dark Films claimed that the wrong materials were shipped to the printers and put up before they realized what had happened, public outcry was such that the MPAA saw fit to suspend the ratings process for the film. As a result, it quickly became apparent that Captivity would fail to procure an MPAA rating before its original target release date(n)

programme.desc: A look at the 1976 Indiana Hoosiers basketball team, led by coach Bobby Knight, that posted a perfect 32-0 record on their way to winning the NCAA national championship(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur
programme.desc: Walt Disney Pictures redefined computer animation with this technically accomplished fantasy of prehistoric life, combining live-action backgrounds with computer-generated animals. After a pterodactyl snatches a dinosaur's egg and accidentally drops it while flying away, the egg is rescued by a family of lemurs, who keep it warm until it hatches. They raise the baby dinosaur, named Aladar, as one of their own, and as he grows to adulthood, Aladar protects the primates that he has come to regard as his family. When a giant meteor appears in the sky, packs of dinosaurs have no idea what to make of the strange fiery light, but Aladar and the lemurs are convinced that they must escape to a safer place before the huge flaming stone destroys their home, leading Aladar to encounter his own kind for the first time. D.B. Sweeney provides the voice of Aladar; other actors in the voice cast include Joan Plowright, Julianna Margulies, Alfre Woodard, and Ossie Davis(n)

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

As he strives to get his career back on track and overcome his heroin addiction, he receives support from his new girlfriend, an actress who was cast to play his lover in a movie about his life(n)

programme.title: Forsaken
programme.desc: In 1872 Wyoming, a Civil War veteran-turned-gunslinger (Kiefer Sutherland) must make amends with his estranged father (Donald Sutherland), a reverend who deplores his son's embrace of violence, as he tries to protect his hometown from ruthless land-grabbers. Jon Cassar directed this menacing Western, which also stars Demi Moore and Brian Cox. Forsaken received its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: No Escape
programme.desc: An American businessman relocates his family to Southeast Asia, but their lives are put in grave danger when they get caught up in a violent political uprising in this nail-biting thriller. As they attempt to reach the U.S. embassy, they are aided by a mysterious British tourist(n)

programme.title: The Free World
programme.desc: Recently released from prison after serving time for a crime he didn't commit, Mo (Boyd Holbrook) realizes that the rest of his community still sees him as a threat. He soon bonds with a woman (Elisabeth Moss) trapped in an abusive relationship with a violent police officer, and vows to protect her from danger. Octavia L. Spencer and Sung Kang co-star in this Southern Gothic-inspired drama, which was written and directed by Jason Lew(n)

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: Screenwriter Charlie Kaufman's bizarre love story about a man who has all memories of his girlfriend erased after they break up(n)

programme.title: I Love You Phillip Morris
programme.desc: Jim Carrey and Ewan McGregor star in this comedy from Glenn Ficarra and John Requa (creators of Bad Santa). Steven Russell is seemingly the ultimate wholesome family man: he plays the organ at church, celebrates good news with a nice glass of healthy milk and prays nightly beside his blonde, blue-eyed wife. But a car accident provokes him to reassess his life; he admits that he is gay, and enthusiastically embraces the epitome of what he imagines a gay lifestyle to be. But his new lifestyle is expensive and he ends up in jail for fraud. There he meets the sensitive Phillip Morris, who he's determined to free from prison - through a series of inventive cons - so that they can secure a future together. McGregor provides the heart of the film, while Carrey turns in a compelling and poignant performance. It's perhaps surprising that this funny and original film is based on a true story. Ficarra and Requa have been in a relationship for more than 20 years, which could explain why the comedy feels more about a man in love, rather than a tale revolving entirely around his sexuality(n)

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: The combination of romance and zombies comedy seems unfeasible... unless it falls into the hands of the brilliant Edgar Wright, co-creator with Simon Pegg (scriptwriter of Zombies Party) of the Spaced series, a milestone in recent British television. In this macabre story, Shaun (Simon Pegg) is down in the dumps, going through an unstoppable crisis in his life. About to turn 30, he passes the time in The Winchester bar, dislikes his job, argues with his mother every day, and the relationship with his girlfriend, Liz (Kate Ashfield), worsens by the hour. When she finally leaves him, Shaun decides, once and for all, to do something about his life. His first step is not visiting a psychologist, but confronting an invasion of living dead with just two weapons: a cricket bat and a shovel! Zombies Party is -at the same time- a parody and a tribute to zombie films(n)

programme.title: Miles Ahead
programme.desc: Don Cheadle co-wrote, directed, and stars in this biopic of legendary jazz musician Miles Davis, which takes a free-form approach to its subject's life that mirrors his playing style. The multi-award- winning film based on Irvine Welsh's novel, stars Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Robert Carlyle, Kelly MacDonald and Kevin McKidd in a story of drugs, survival, scams, friendship and tragedy(n)

programme.title: Truth
programme.desc: James Vanderbilt wrote and directed this docudrama about the controversial 60 Minutes exposé on then-president George W. Bush's military service that aired just before the 2004 election. Cate Blanchett stars as Mary Mapes, the producer of CBS's newsmagazine series 60 Minutes, which was anchored at the time by the legendary Dan Rather (Robert Redford). Mapes gets a tip from a new source who claims to possess explosive documents proving that Bush received privileged treatment in the National Guard to avoid service in the Vietnam War. After the documents are presented to the American people, a whirlwind of controversy about the their veracity pits Mapes and Rather in a battle for their journalistic lives. Topher Grace, Dennis Quaid, and Elizabeth Moss co-star in this ensemble journalistic thriller(n)

programme.title: Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid
programme.desc: Johnny Messner, Kadee Strickland, Matthew Marsden, Morris Chestnut, Nicholas Gonzalez. (2004) Sequel with Matthew Marsden in which a team of scientists go in search of a flower which causes immortality. The local anacondas have already discovered its properties. Dir: Dwight H Little(n)

He begins a violent campaign of intimidation and harassment against his new neighbours, and will apparently stop at nothing to force them out of their home(n)

programme.title: Passengers

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: A wealthy tycoon whose life is orderly and happy finds his household disrupted by the arrival of a young man called Joe Black. His daughter falls for the young man innocent of the fact that Joe is Death, visiting Earth to take the life of her father..(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Critically acclaimed director David Gordon Green takes a break from the brooding drama that defined such early efforts as George Washington and Undertow for this action-flavored buddy comedy concerning two pot-smoking friends (Seth Rogen and James Franco) who unwittingly become involved with a vicious gang of drug dealers. Judd Apatow and Shauna Robertson produce a script co-penned by star Rogen and Evan Goldberg(n)

programme.title: Black Sails

programme.title: Black Sails
programme.desc: XXII. Flint, Silver and Billy square off against a new enemy; civilization returns to Nassau, and puts Vane in its crosshairs; Rackham makes a stand against the crew; and Scott finds a place with the new regime(n)

programme.title: Power
programme.sub-title: The Kind of Man You Are
programme.desc: The Kind of Man You Are. Prosecutors turn up the heat, forcing Tommy's plan to divert their attention; Teresi obtains information about Ghost and engineers a blackmail scheme; in his father's absence, Tariq seeks out Kanan(n)

programme.title: Jarhead
programme.desc: Gritty Gulf War drama based on a former US Marine's best-selling memoir about his experiences in Saudi Arabia and Kuwait. Anthony 'Swoff' Swofford makes it through boot camp to become a Marine sniper and is sent to Saudi Arabia, where he and his unit wait for action. It takes another 175 days of heat, boredom, tension and worries about girlfriends at home before the fighting actually starts. But when it comes, war does not look the way Swoff expects it to(n)

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: A dramatization of a political coup by renegade German officers against Hitler during World War II(n)

programme.title: Young@Heart
programme.desc: The Young@Heart Chorus is a vocal group from Northampton, MA, who have earned an international reputation for their unique interpretations of songs by Sonic Youth, the Ramones, and the Clash. However, this isn't a teenage garage band attacking the classic punk rock songbook -- the Young@Heart Chorus is comprised of 22 senior citizens whose average age is 80, and under director Bob Cilman they've gained a degree of fame for their enthusiastic a cappella renditions of well-known rock & roll tunes. Filmmaker Stephen Walker spent several weeks with the members of the Young@Heart Chorus as they rehearsed for their annual concert in Northampton, and Young@Heart is a documentary which offers a look at their rigorous rehearsal process, the background of several members, and their efforts to stay active and think positive, even as their friends succumb to old age. Produced for British television, Young@Heart was screened in competition at the 2007 Los Angeles Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The International
programme.desc: Clive Owen ("Inside Man") and Naomi Watts ("King Kong") star in this thriller about an Interpol agent who teams with a Manhattan Assistant D.A. on a dangerous chase across the globe to expose a powerful bank's financing of terror and war. Directed by Tom Tykwer ("Run, Lola, Run"). Armin Mueller-Stahl, Ulrich Thomsen, Brian F. O'Byrne(n)

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: Nicholson stars as a selfish drifter fleeing his middle-class background and his own tortured talent(n)

programme.title: The Patience Stone
programme.desc: A woman living in a war-torn country confides her fears to her paralysed husband after he is abandoned by his family and fellow soldiers. In time, her confessions transform her wounded spouse into a magical amulet that shields her from suffering(n)

programme.title: The Lady in the Van
programme.desc: A homeless woman parks her van in the driveway of playwright Alan Bennett's house and lives there for 15 years. Over the course of her stay, the two form a unique friendship(n)

programme.title: Sunshine
programme.desc: Ralph Fiennes plays three characters in Istvan Szabo's compelling epic, which chronicles three generations in a Hungarian-Jewish family. The story focuses on the Sonnenschein clan and the anti-Semitism they face---especially when Hitler comes to power. Rosemary Harris, Rachel Weisz, Jennifer Ehle, Molly Parker, Deborah Kara Unger(n)

programme.title: Sexy Beast
programme.desc: Ray Winstone and Ben Kingsley star in this Oscar and BAFTA-nominated crime thriller from director Jonathan Glazer. Winstone is Gary, a top professional criminal now living in retirement with wife Deedee in Spain. But the peace of retirement is shattered by his former associate Don, a violent psychopath sent by underworld boss Teddy Bass to persuade Gary, by any means necessary, to return for one last job. What follows is a battle of wills between the two men, one threatening, the other reluctant, until matters reach a dramatic, violent conclusion(n)

programme.title: Son of Saul
programme.desc: In this searing drama, a concentration-camp inmate (Géza Röhrig) tasked with burning the dead discovers the body of his young son, and must choose between participating in a clandestine uprising being planned among the prisoners or securing a proper Jewish burial for his child(n)

programme.title: Dark Horse
programme.desc: In this crowd-pleasing documentary, a Welsh barmaid decides to try her hand at breeding and raising a racehorse, and sells shares in the animal to her regulars at the pub in order to pay for expenses. Their horse eventually competes against some of the top thoroughbreds in the U.K(n)

programme.title: Marley
programme.desc: Oscar-winning documentarian Kevin Macdonald (One Day in September) examines the life of pioneering reggae artist Bob Marley in this film featuring intimate footage from the family's personal archives(n)

programme.title: To Rome With Love
programme.desc: In this poignant, hilarious ensemble film, locals and tourists in Rome find their lives intersecting. An architect tries to recapture his youth; an ordinary guy unexpectedly becomes famous; a couple are torn apart by new love interests; an opera director tries to get a mortician to sing on stage(n)

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: Elegant account of an English butler's professional and emotional life, examined retrospectively during a journey toward a reunion with the housekeeper he loved years before. He recalls his lengthy unquestioned service with a reactionary, pro-Nazi aristocrat, and his painfully unfulfilled relationship with the woman he is going to meet. Meticulous Merchant Ivory production based on Kazuo Ishiguro's novel(n)

programme.title: Once
programme.desc: A Dublin busker strikes up a tentative relationship with a Czech immigrant girl, their mutual love of music bringing them closer together(n)

programme.title: Testament of Youth
programme.desc: In this gripping historical drama, an adventurous young British woman wins a scholarship to Oxford, where she falls in love with a fellow student. Later, their relationship is tested when he joins the military following the onset of World War I(n)

programme.desc: Remake of the 1949 classic chronicling the rise and fall of ruthless Louisiana politician Willie Stark(n)

programme.desc: A widowed Englishman and a Danish hairdresser who's been left by her husband forge a fragile romance during a trip to Italy to see their son and daughter get married(n)

programme.title: No Pay, Nudity
programme.desc: A struggling, aging actor must overcome personal and professional strife as he tries to make it and land a career breakthrough(n)

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: Maggie, a young woman longing to start a family, becomes involved in a complicated love triangle with a struggling novelist and his haughty theorist wife(n)

programme.title: Once
programme.desc: A Dublin busker strikes up a tentative relationship with a Czech immigrant girl, their mutual love of music bringing them closer together(n)

programme.title: Rio, I Love You
programme.desc: Another installment of the Cities of Love franchise, this anthology film depicts romantic encounters in different neighborhoods of Rio de Janeiro. In all, ten shorts helmed by celebrated directors are woven together to spin a tale of love in "the Marvelous City." Directors include Fernando Meirelles, José Padilha, Paolo Sorrentino, and John Turturro. Vincent Cassel, Harvey Keitel, Emily Mortimer, Vanessa Paradis, and Wagner Moura star in the various segments(n)

programme.title: I'm So Excited!
programme.desc: The passengers and crew of an airliner find their lives in jeopardy due to a technical failure, and experience a collective catharsis that helps to ward off the specter of death as the pilots work to land the plane safely in this wild comedy(n)

programme.title: Hard Sell
programme.desc: A private-school student (Skyler Gisondo) struggles to earn enough money to support his unstable mother (Kristin Chenoweth). He soon meets a beautiful runaway (Katrina Bowden), and together they hatch a plan to profit from her stunning good looks. Sean Nalaboff wrote and directed this dramedy(n)

programme.title: Undrafted
programme.desc: A college baseball star is unexpectedly passed over during the MLB draft. Later, a meaningless game with his offbeat intramural pals turns into a pivotal, cathartic moment for him as he struggles to overcome his disappointment. Aaron Tveit, Tyler Hoechlin, Joseph Mazzello, Chace Crawford, and James Belushi star. Undrafted is the feature directorial debut of Mazzello, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: Nothing can snap a philosophy professor (Joaquin Phoenix) out of a mental funk, except for a student (Emma Stone) whose presence offers a breath of fresh air(n)

programme.title: Big Night
programme.desc: Two Italian brothers struggle to get their restaurant business off the ground, and so gamble success or failure on one special night of feasting(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: Shelley is living a carefree life until a rival gets her tossed out of the Playboy Mansion. With nowhere to go, fate delivers her to the sorority girls from Zeta Alpha Zeta. Unless they can sign a new pledge class, the seven socially clueless women will lose their house to the scheming girls of Phi Iota Mu. In order to accomplish their goal, they need Shelley to teach them the ways of makeup and men at the same time, Shelley needs some of what the Zetas have: a sense of individuality. The combination leads all the girls to learn how to stop pretending and start being themselves(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: Anarchic comedy about a Rhode Island state trooper with a split personality who falls in love with the woman he is supposed to be escorting to New York for questioning. When he loses the medication that keeps his unpleasant alter ego at bay, both sides of his personality fight each other for the lady's affections(n)

programme.title: My Blind Brother
programme.desc: A slacker named Bill (Nick Kroll) lives in the shadow of his vastly more successful brother Robbie (Adam Scott), an athlete whose achievements are made even more impressive due to the fact that he's blind. When the pair both fall for the same woman (Jenny Slate), Bill is forced compete against his arrogant, narcissistic sibling for the first time. Zoe Kazan co-stars. Written and directed by Sophie Goodhart(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: Shelley is living a carefree life until a rival gets her tossed out of the Playboy Mansion. With nowhere to go, fate delivers her to the sorority girls from Zeta Alpha Zeta. Unless they can sign a new pledge class, the seven socially clueless women will lose their house to the scheming girls of Phi Iota Mu. In order to accomplish their goal, they need Shelley to teach them the ways of makeup and men at the same time, Shelley needs some of what the Zetas have: a sense of individuality. The combination leads all the girls to learn how to stop pretending and start being themselves(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: Comedy superstar Jim Carrey takes a risky leap into darker territory in The Cable Guy, a black comedy that featured the charismatic comic at his least likable. Matthew Broderick plays Steven Kovacs, who moves into a bachelor pad when his girlfriend (Leslie Mann) turns down his marriage proposal. Kovacs orders cable service and is greeted by Carrey's Chip Douglas, a manic, troubled geek with a lisp and an oddly menacing air. Chip insinuates himself into Kovacs' life, at first helping him win back his girlfriend, then becoming obsessively attached to his new friend to the point of becoming an ultimately relentless stalker. The film's uneven blend of humor, satire, and homoeroticism, as well as Carrey's departure from his usual goofy performances, received a lukewarm response from audiences(n)

programme.desc: The inept Inspector Clouseau must solve the mystery of a murdered French football coach and retrieve the priceless Pink Panther diamond. Steve Martin steps into the shoes of the legendary Peter Sellers(n)

programme.title: The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
programme.desc: Rebecca Miller (The Ballad of Jack & Rose) adapts her own novel with this comedy drama about a woman who begins a second life after her husband leaves her for a younger woman. Pippa Lee (Robin Wright) is the loving mother of two grown children, and the wife of successful publisher Herb (Alan Arkin). Despite the fact that she's 30 years Herb's junior, Pippa and her husband have never fallen short on things to talk about. She's always enjoyed the hustle and bustle of New York, but after Herb suffers a serious heart attack, Pippa dutifully moves with him to a quaint suburban home in small-town Connecticut. And for a while, at least, she coasts -- enjoying frequent dinner parties with her new friends Sam (Mike Binder) and Sandra (Winona Ryder), and spending quiet nights caring for Herb, who has lately grown increasingly distant. That all starts to change when Chris (Keanu Reeves) comes back to town following a bitter divorce. Gradually, Pippa's suppressed resentments begin bubbling to the surface, highlighting the conflict between the free-spirited girl she used to be and the frustrated woman who has taken her place. Somewhere along the line, Pippa lost track of her own identity. But Pippa's remarkable journey of self-discovery is just beginning. Julianne Moore, Monica Bellucci, Maria Bello, and Blake Lively co-star in a Plan B Entertainment production(n)

programme.title: A Smile like Yours
programme.desc: An understanding couple try their best to conceive a child(n)

programme.title: Roll Bounce
programme.desc: A handful of inner-city kids move up to the big time in this teen-centric musical. Xavier Smith (Bow Wow), known to his friends as X, is a teenager growing up on the South Side of Chicago in the late '70s. X and his buddies are the hotshot skaters at the Palisades Gardens, a neighborhood roller rink where local kids roll to the latest disco sounds, but X loses his status as king of the hill when the Palisades closes down. With no skating action close by, X and his friends head uptown to the Sweetwater Roller Rink, where they feel like country mice in the big city among the expert skate dancers and beautiful women. But skating means a lot to X -- with his widower father, Curtis (Chi McBride) going through a bad patch, skating gives him a sense of accomplishment and a belief in his own talent. So X and company keep heading uptown to Sweetwater, where they prepare to take on Sweetness (Wesley Jonathan) and his crew of the rink's best dancers for the upcoming Roller Jam Skate-Off. X befriends a young local girl named Tori (Jurnee Smolett) and finds a good reason to go uptown when he meets a pretty skater girl, Naomi (Meagan Good). Meanwhile, Tori's mother, Vivian (Kellita Smith) takes an interest in Curtis. Featuring a score of classic '70s R&B and disco, Roll Bounce was directed by Malcolm D. Lee, who enjoyed a breakthrough hit with 2002's Undercover Brother(n)

programme.title: Back to School
programme.desc: In order to encourage his freshman son, an uneducated, self-made millionaire enrolls in college(n)

programme.title: Van Wilder: Freshman Year
programme.desc: Comedy prequel, the third adventure in the Van Wilder series(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther

Meanwhile, Tori's mother, Vivian (Kellita Smith) takes an interest in Curtis. Featuring a score of classic '70s R&B and disco, Roll Bounce was directed by Malcolm D. Lee, who enjoyed a breakthrough hit with 2002's Undercover Brother(n)

programme.title: The Wood
programme.desc: Rick Famuyiwa's comedy/drama stars Taye Diggs (recently seen in Chicago), Richard T Jones from Phone Booth and Omar Epps, seen meeting up on Digg's wedding day. Or rather, not meeting up - he's done a runner but his friends track him down and as they try to give him the courage to make it to the wedding. Their stories are recounted from their youth in the 80s (with Trent Cameron, Duane Finley and Sean Nelson as the younger versions), when they met at high school and follows them through their rites-of-passage - dating, getting involved in a store robbery by mistake, getting their first jobs. Famuyiwa's debut movie, following three black middle class teenagers, has a certain charm and the three leads are ably supported by a cast including Malinda Williams as the cutest girl in school and Tamal Jones as the ex-girlfriend Diggs seeks refuge with in the Wood rather than the Hood(n)

programme.title: Biggie and Tupac
programme.desc: Nick Broomfield, director of Heidi Fleiss: Hollywood Madam and Kurt and Courtney, unleashes another provocation with Biggie and Tupac. Considering Broomfield's track record, that the film is dangerous, sensational, and occasionally very funny is no surprise. What is somewhat shocking, in a very rewarding and commendable way, is how moving Biggie and Tupac is. Using archival footage of the two rap stars and interviews with many of those involved, Broomfield uncovers significant evidence that corrupt LAPD cops were involved in the two deaths, and that the FBI was doing surveillance on Biggie (Christopher Wallace) on the night he was murdered. Broomfield's film also strongly suggests that Death Row Records head Suge Knight orchestrated both murders. Few satisfactory conclusions are drawn, but the film should at least encourage further investigation of these claims. By running the camera constantly, even before the interviews begin, Broomfield frequently catches his subjects off guard. But even if Broomfield had uncovered nothing, Biggie and Tupac would still be an entertaining and valuable telling of the tragic deaths of two talented young men. The filmmaker's interviews with Biggie's friends, and particularly his charming mother, Voletta Wallace, paint a picture of a surprisingly sensitive and goodhearted young man. Broomfield was granted less access to Tupac Shakur's family (Tupac's mother is still involved in business dealings with Knight; she doesn't appear in the film and she refused Broomfield permission to use Tupac's music), but he still manages to expose the controversial rapper's essential humanity. Some will find Broomfield's sarcastic and edgy attitude grating. He doesn't have the puppy-dog charm of a Michael Moore. But with Biggie and Tupac, he's shown a bit more of his sensitive side, and he's taken a step forward as a filmmaker(n)

programme.title: Passengers
programme.desc: Young therapist Claire (Anne Hathaway) is assigned to counsel the survivors of a plane crash and is intrigued by Eric, the most secretive of them. In spite of that, her professional relationship with him blossoms into a romance as the survivors begin to disappear mysteriously, one by one. Claire suspects that Eric may hold the answers and becomes determined to uncover the truth, no matter the consequences(n)

programme.title: Smoke
programme.desc: A Brooklyn cigar-store owner observes life as it occurs in and around his shop(n)

programme.title: New Jersey Drive
programme.desc: New Jersey Drive opens with Jason (Gabriel Casseus) heading off to juvenile detention then unfolds in flashback as, chronologically, the incidents leading to his arrest surface one by one. First the audience sees his violence and poverty-ridden project; next his go-nowhere delinquent friends are introduced, as is their hobby: joy riding. Soon some of the teens, including Jason, begin to convert their hobby into a part-time job as they steal cars and sell them to a sleazy chop-shop owner for pennies on the dollar. Eventually, luck runs out when they are caught in a police sting; one boy is shot to death by the crooked Officer Roscoe (Saul Stein), who then warns Jason not to tell a soul; however, they continue stealing cars. Meanwhile, Jason beats up a neighborhood acquaintance on the playground for a slight to his sister and finds himself the target of the boy's murder attempts. The action draws to a head as both Roscoe and the vengeful boy close in(n)

programme.title: Men of Honor
programme.desc: Remarkable yarn about Carl Brashear, the first African- American diver in the US Navy(n)

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A young woman throws her parents into a moral turmoil when she brings her black fiancé home to dinner. Drama(n)

programme.title: Seven Pounds
programme.desc: Drama about tax inspector Ben Thomas, who is driven to acts of incredible kindness for anonymous reasons. Crossing paths with seven very different people, including a blind call centre worker, an abused single mother and a heart disease patient with only months to live, he is compelled to be a good Samaritan. When he falls in love with the heart patient, a life-changing experience of guilt and tragedy is revealed(n)

The first black officer in the Sheriff's Department struggles against the racially-hostile attitudes of the other officers, but finds an ally in the only female member of the department. When their colleagues accuse an innocent man of murder, the precinct's two outsiders have to question their loyalties carefully(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Where's the Boss. Al (Ed O'Neill) is wrong when he jumps to the conclusion that his never-seen boss Gary (Geoffrey Scott) has died, but he is right on the money when he concludes that Gary has gone out of his way to avoid him. His gorge rising, Al demands that his boss acknowledge his existence--or he'll quit. The role of Ed is played by veteran character actor Lewis Arquette, the father of actresses Rosanna Arquette and Patricia Arquette(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Johnny Be Gone. "You can watch reruns or you can watch Fox" blared the original ads for this, the final episode of Married. . .With Children's first season (ironically, you'd be watching reruns on Fox one week later). The plot is set in motion when Al and Peg learn that their favorite hamburger joint, Johnny B. Goods, is soon to close its doors for good. As the Bundy try to attend the restaurant's last night, they are constantly delayed by the misadventures of their children--and their anxiety spills over to their next-door neighbors Steve (David Garrison) and Marcy (Amanda Bearse), who are planning to throw a party for some VIPs. (This is one of the series' two episodes to be taped in a single, long, continuous "scene")(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Poppy's by the Tree. Married. . .With Children launches its second season with the series' first two-part episode (originally networkcast in a single hour-long timeslot). "Borrowing" their neighbors' car, the Bundy family embarks upon a vacation, ending up in a sleazy hotel in Dumpwater, Florida. The town happens to be famous for two things: It's the home of "the man who shook the hand of Andy Griffith", and also the home of a brutal axe murderer who strikes every five years--and specializes in hacking up tourists. As the locals place bets as to who will be the killer's next victims, guess which family strolls into the scene? (Aw, you guessed.)(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: The Revenge. Revenge is in the air for the entire Seinfeld gang in this second-season episode. First, George and Elaine decide to hatch a plan to get back at George's boss for not rehiring him after he quit when he was demoted to using the regular bathroom. Meanwhile, Jerry and Kramer come up with a scheme involving a washing machine full of cement after Jerry suspects the launderer of stealing 1,500 dollars from him. Viewers may want to note that this episode features the first appearance of the character Newman, who is only heard over the phone. Originally the voice was that of co-creator/writer Larry David, but after Wayne Knight took on the role, the scenes were redone with his voice for reruns of the episode. Originally airing April 18, 1991, "The Revenge" as the 12th episode shot for the second season, despite being the seventh one shown(n)

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: A former slave and a German bounty hunter become unlikely allies in the battle against a tyrannical plantation owner in this western from visionary director Quentin Tarantino. Two years before the Civil War pits brother-against-brother, German-born fugitive hunter Dr. King Schultz (Academy Award-winner Christoph Waltz) arrives in America determined to capture the outlaw Brittle brothers dead or alive. In the midst of his search, Dr. Schultz crosses paths with Django (Academy Award-winner Jamie Foxx), a freed slave and skilled tracker who seeks to rescue his beloved wife Broomhilda (Kerry Washington) from ruthless plantation owner Calvin Candie (Academy Award-nominee Leonardo DiCaprio). Once Django has aided Dr. Schultz in coralling the Brittle brothers, the two team up to capture some of the most wanted men in the South. Meanwhile, Django never loses sight of his mission to free Broomhilda from the treacherous slave trade before it's too late. Upon arriving at Candie's nefarious plantation, dubbed Candyland, Django and Dr. Schultz discover that slaves are being groomed for gladiator-like competitions by Candie's malevolent right-hand man Billy Crash (Walton Goggins), and together they skillfully work their way onto the compound for a closer look. But just as Django and his partner locate Broomhilda and plot a daring escape, Candie's house slave Stephen (Academy Award-nominee Samuel L. Jackson) catches wind of their plan, and informs his master of the betrayal. Now, as a clandestine organization attempts to back them into a corner, Django and Dr. Schultz will have to come out with pistols blazing if they ever hope to free Broomhilda from Candyland and the clutches of its vile proprietor(n)
